title: A Long Way From Mexico: Company Bets China Has an Appetite for Taco Bell
description: SHANGHAI  Until he was appointed manager of a Taco Bell in China, Will Cao had never seen a taco before. When confronted with its hard, U-shaped shell in Los Angeles last June, he wondered: How do you eat it?

title: Before Fifty Shades Darker: 10 Kinky Films
description: Fifty Shades Darker, the Fifty Shades of Grey sequel that chronicles the relationship between a budding journalist and a damaged business scion with an affection for whips and chains, is released in the United States today.

title: Daytime TVs New Star? Sean Spicer
description: He is no match for The Young and the Restless. But he is beating The Bold and the Beautiful.

title: A New Designer (and Robert De Niro) for a Re-energized Zegna
description: Ermenegildo Zegna and Alessandro Sartori were reminiscing about a meeting the two had last year in the Italian Alps, near where both men grew up. Inside the brands Fifth Avenue store, they explained, they started discussing the future course of the family-owned fashion label Ermenegildo Zegna and ended up talking about almost everything.

title: A Marriage of Art and Film at Berlin Festival
description: BERLIN  The power of a famous patron was on show this week in Berlin. The 67th Berlinale, the annual film festival, opened  and so did the first exhibit by a U.S. artist, Joe Ramirez, 58, whose work caught the eye of the German filmmaker Wim Wenders (Salt of the Earth,  Every Thing Will be Fine) after the two met three years ago.

title: Microbes, a Love Story
description: This Valentines Day, as you bask in the beauty of your beloved, dont just thank his or her genes and your good fortune; thank microbes.

title: The Pace Quickens for Construction in Murray Hill
description: A quiet area is seeing new rentals and condos with plenty of amenities to keep residents happy and entice them to stay.

title: New High-End Rentals and Condos Coming to Murray Hill
description: Murray Hill, long known as a go-to rental area for postgraduates, is going through some growing pains. With several new rental and condominium buildings popping up, along with continuing restoration work at the Queens-Midtown Tunnel, the once-peaceful eastern Midtown enclave is quiet no more.

title: A Video, a Wheelchair, a Suitcase: Mystery of Vanished Tycoon Deepens
description: HONG KONG  In a newspaper ad, the Hong Kong billionaire declared that he was just fine, merely resting overseas. The local news media insists that he is helping with an important investigation in China. The police say he left the territory through a normal border control point.

title: Shopping for Love Seats
description: Because a love seat is intended for only two people, it might seem like the ideal piece of furniture to curl up on for Valentines Day. But for city dwellers trying to make the most of small-scale rooms, love seats are appealing year-round, and may even take the place of larger sofas.

title: How to Take a Cosmic View on a Trump Stock Market
description: The Trump stock market rally has displayed formidable staying power, yet there are reasons to be uneasy.

title: Former A.I.G. Executives Reach Settlement in Accounting Fraud Case
description: Maurice R. Greenberg, the former chief executive of American International Group, reached an unexpected settlement ending a tumultuous, decade-long battle over civil accounting fraud charges first brought in 2005 by New York Attorney General Eliot Spitzer.

title: Ladies Who Lunch
description: Benefits and galas were held last week for: Womans Day, the Society of Memorial Sloan Kettering, Waterkeeper Alliance and Lyce Franais de New York.

title: Ladies Who Lunch
description: Womans Day held its annual Red Dress Awards on Feb. 7 at Jazz at Lincoln Center. Net-a-Porter and the Society of Memorial Sloan Kettering hosted a lunch at the Rainbow Room on Feb. 7 to raise money for pediatric cancer. The Waterkeeper Alliance, which advocates clean water, held a benefit auction at Sothebys on Feb. 6. And Lyce Franais de New York honored Christy Turlington at its Feb. 4 gala at the Park Avenue Armory.

title: The Best Cities to Find Single Men or Women
description: Your chances for romance may be directly affected by where you live. Thats what a recent posting by Trulia.com suggests, anyway.

title: Job for Chocolate and Candy Taster Takes More Than a Sweet Tooth
description: READING, England  Some people like to take a break from work with a quick bite of chocolate. But what if a quick bite of chocolate was your work?

title: Illegal Voting Gets Texas Woman 8 Years in Prison, and Certain Deportation
description: Despite repeated statements by Republican political leaders that American elections are rife with illegal voting, credible reports of fraud have been hard to find and convictions rarer still.

title: Will the Grammy Awards End With a Big Surprise?
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: An Art Show Celebrates a Once-Maligned Material: Plastic
description: When DeWain Valentine was deciding what to title his newly organized Plastic Show, he paid homage to an exhibition he helped put together some 45 years back. I named that The Last Plastics Show, recalls the artist of the earlier CalArts exhibition. Thered been so many shows regarding plastic and art that I thought it was the last one that I wanted to be in!

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Betsy DeVos Is Briefly Blocked From Entering a School
description: WASHINGTON  The newly minted education secretary, Betsy DeVos, fled a small group of protesters outside a middle school here on Friday, at one point hiding in her sport utility vehicle as a man wielded a cardboard sign, before she finally entered.

title: A Piano Rang Out Like Gunfire: The 8 Best Classical Music Moments This Week
description: Our critics are your guides to the chords that sent shivers down their spines, the voices they cant forget, the set changes that left them breathless.

title: Knicks Invent New Type of Loss as Owner Banishes Charles Oakley
description: The Knicks, who were already raising dysfunction to an art form with bad basketball and head-scratching Twitter posts from their famous team president, moved further into the surreal on Friday when the teams owner announced that he was indefinitely barring one of the most popular players in franchise history from Madison Square Garden.

title: As Fighting Escalates in Ukraine, Attention Focuses on Donald Trump
description: AVDIIVKA, Ukraine  Here at the epicenter of the latest spasm of violence in eastern Ukraine, great thuds of artillery shells could be heard in the distance on Friday, as residents scrambled to board up blown-out windows and stockpile groceries in anticipation of further shelling.

title: Facebook Takes Steps to Improve Advertising Data After Criticism
description: Facebook said on Friday that it would agree to an audit of information it provides to marketers and provide them with new, more precise measurement data, less than two weeks after Procter & Gamble, Americas biggest advertiser, criticized the lack of transparency provided by digital ad platforms.

title: Review: The Dark Side of the Sun, and, by the Way, Were Doomed
description: Americans fears of nuclear annihilation well up every few decades. Early 1960s: the Cuban missile crisis. 1980s: the Soviet Unions reaction to the Star Wars defense plan. Now: Were going to war in the South China Sea in five to 10 years, theres no doubt about that  Stephen K. Bannon.

title: Stairways to Adventure
description: Fire escapes give city dwellers a place to get away for awhile.

title: Voyeur: Fire Escapes
description: We belong, we belong awake.

title: What Happened to Elizabeth Warren Has Roots in Racism
description: This week, the Senate voted 49 to 43 to silence one of its own members. Whether the Republicans who forced Senator Elizabeth Warren, the Massachusetts Democrat, to sit down knew it or not, they added another chapter to a long and infamous tradition of manipulating congressional rules to prevent an open discussion of race.

title: Billions Season 2 Premiere: Neanderthals
description: Sliding along an earth-trembling bass line, Harry Nilssons Jump into the Fire is the first music cue on this season of Billions, and for a show thats always curated its soundtrack thoughtfully, the choice is significant. Cinephiles will instantly recognize it from the final third of Goodfellas, when the story of Henry Hill suddenly shifts from a decades-spanning gangster epic to a frantic, paranoid, cocaine-fueled day in the life. You can climb a mountain, you can swim in the sea, Nilsson sings, You can jump into the fire, but youll never be free. Those doom-laden lyrics suggest that even powerful men cannot transcend their situation, and Season 2 seems intent on putting the squeeze on Chuck Rhoades and Bobby Axelrod.

title: This City Ballet Dancer Has a New Role: Being Bad
description: Fairies can be so fickle. One night, all you want to do is break a spell. The next, with ice in your veins and a malicious flourish, you put a curse into action.

title: Breaking Up the Family as a Way to Break Up the Mob
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy  Fighting the mafia at the very toe of Italy, Roberto Di Bella has seen a lot: children as young as 11 or 12 serving as lookouts during murders, attending drug deals and mob strategy sessions, or learning how to handle a Kalashnikov assault rifle.

title: How Should a Musician Make a Debut? Try Going Low-Key
description: A lot was at stake for the pianist Dmitry Masleev when he made his New York recital debut on Jan. 30 at Carnegie Hall. After he took the gold medal in the 2015 International Tchaikovsky Competition, New Yorkers would have a chance to hear what the fuss was about.

title: Street Style: New York Fashion Week
description: The start of the fall 2017 ready-to-wear season brings the well-dressed to New York Citys sidewalks.

title: Street Style: New York Fashion Week
description: New York Fashion Week is in full swing, and with it comes street style. Well be updating all week with looks from between the shows. Come back soon.

title: Ford to Invest $1 Billion in Artificial Intelligence Start-Up
description: SAN FRANCISCO  One of the oldest automakers in the United States is making a billion-dollar bet that one day, owning a car may not be a necessity of American life.

title: Shinzo Abe, Executive Orders: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Pastry for Those Who Prefer Savory to Sweet
description: When I want a satisfying snack, more often than not I opt for something salty, spicy or crisp  a slice of pizza, a taco, an empanada. If I pop into a bakery, its the savory, cheesy items that appeal, not the sweets.

title: Long Before Making Enigmatic Earthworks, People Reshaped Brazils Rain Forest
description: Deep in the Amazon, the rain forest once covered ancient secrets. Spread across hundreds of thousands of acres are massive, geometric earthworks. The carvings stretch out in circles and squares that can be as big as a city block, with trenches up to 12 yards wide and 13 feet deep. They appear to have been built up to 2,000 years ago.

title: Hundreds of Beached Whales Die in New Zealand
description: More than 250 pilot whales died on the coastline, one of the worst whale strandings in the country's history.

title: Review: Unknown Pleasures Makes Unfulfilled Promises
description: Do you look at a dance work differently if you dont know who made it? A choreographers name, like that of any artist, is a brand  a repository for reputation, necessary for fandom and crucial for marketing. But that same reputation can become a trap, compelling an artist to deliver the familiar and a viewer to expect it, with preconceptions and prejudices that can obscure the work.

title: Rag & Bone Says No to the Runway Show
description: Marcus Wainwright, the chief executive and creative director of Rag & Bone, sat in his 13th Street Rag & Bone studio, converted for two days into two makeshift photo studios to shoot 74 portraits, with all of the chaos and confusion that entailed. At one side, the photographer Glen Luchford worked a Polaroid camera the size of a small car that churns out 20-inch-by-24-inch instant photos on ancient, rapidly expiring, no-longer-in-production film. At another, Frank Lebon coaxed his subjects into bouncing on trampolines as he shot them on film and an iPhone.

title: Anthony Huxley, the Anti-Jock of City Ballet
description: In dance, voice can refer to the way a body moves, not just the words that come from it. It has taken Anthony Huxley, shy by nature, time to find both. For years, he rarely spoke. He could hide behind his impeccable technique. Its almost as if a classical step, beautifully executed, became a kind of armor used to shield himself from the world.

title: Svend Asmussen, an Early Master of Jazz Violin, Dies at 100
description: Svend Asmussen, a Danish jazz violinist whose collaborators over more than 70 years included Duke Ellington, Benny Goodman, the Indian violinist L. Subramaniam and the bluegrass mandolinist David Grisman, died on Feb. 7. He was 100.

title: De Blasio and Stringer Trade Barbs Over Police Body Camera Deal
description: On a day when he might have been enjoying praise for a smooth response to the years first big snowstorm and in an upbeat mood over his coming State of the City speech, Mayor Bill de Blasio on Friday instead stepped in a puddle of slush of his own making.

title: Mexican Government Rejects Findings of Misconduct in Missing Students Case
description: MEXICO CITY  The final version of an internal review by the Mexican government into the conduct of investigators searching for 43 missing students has rejected an earlier report that found that the officials mishandling of suspects and evidence broke the law.

title: Review: Its Norman Mailer vs. Feminists in The Town Hall Affair
description: Im beside myself. Im beside myself, mutters an anxious and excited Jill Johnston at the beginning of The Town Hall Affair, the very timely and time-bending new mixed-media piece thats churning up decades of sexual discontent at the Performing Garage in SoHo. Johnston (reincarnated by Kate Valk), the poetic polemicist whose works included Lesbian Nation: The Feminist Solution, sure isnt alone in feeling that way.

title: 8 Things You Missed From the First 2 Days of Fashion Week
description: On Thursday, up to 14 inches of snow fell in the New York area. Flights and trains were disrupted. Schools closed.

title: Ljubisa Beara, Who Oversaw Massacre at Srebrenica, Dies at 77
description: Col. Ljubisa Beara, the Bosnian Serb Army security chief sentenced to life imprisonment for genocide in 2010 in the massacre of as many as 8,000 Muslim men and boys near Srebrenica in 1995  the worst mass murder in Europe since World War II  died on Wednesday in Berlin. He was 77.

title: Jason Wu: Fall 2017
description: Mr. Wu, a favorite of Michelle Obama, shows his fall looks.

title: At 35, Canadian Ski Racer Is Finding His Groove
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland  Erik Guay believes that downhill ski racers can improve with age.

title: The Ties That Blind
description: Lost in the excitement and outrage of Donald Trumps first three weeks as president of the United States was a minor sartorial scandal: The putative leader of the free world cannot tie a necktie properly. Compared with religious persecution at our borders and the unraveling of decades-old international alliances, this may seem trivial. But could a misbegotten (and far too shiny) necktie reflect weightier issues of self-discipline, competence and integrity?

title: A Pianists Warsaw: Fascination and Pain
description: In 2006, the pianist Piotr Anderszewski took his first sabbatical. He had no clear purpose in scheduling a break from concertizing and recording  no special project in mind, like learning new repertory. He just wanted time to think and relax, to cook a beautiful meal and share it with good friends, as he explained in an interview last month in New York.

title: As Ties With U.S. Cool, Europeans Look to Forge Other Alliances
description: WASHINGTON  The weather, and her reception here, were far colder than when she visited last summer during the Obama administration, but Federica Mogherini, the European Unions foreign minister, made it clear that she can handle a chill in the air.

title: Mike Ilitch, Little Caesars Founder and Detroit Sports Owner, Dies at 87
description: Mike Ilitch, a self-made son of immigrants who founded Little Caesars Pizza in a Detroit suburb and also owned baseballs Tigers and hockeys Red Wings, building a business, sports and entertainment empire that made him among Americas wealthiest men and helped change the face of his native city, died on Friday in Detroit. He was 87.

title: 2 New York City Men Plead Guilty to Trying to Help the Islamic State
description: Two New York City men have pleaded guilty to federal charges that they plotted a pressure-cooker bomb attack in the city on behalf of the Islamic State, prosecutors said on Friday.

title: Chicago Officer Who Shot Teenager and Bystander Will Not Be Charged
description: CHICAGO  A police officer here who fatally shot an innocent bystander and a 19-year-old wielding a baseball bat will not face state charges, prosecutors announced on Friday.

title: Nicolai Gedda, Celebrated Opera Tenor, Dies at 91
description: Nicolai Gedda, the Swedish singer who rose from an impoverished childhood and a youthful career as a bank clerk to become one of the most celebrated tenors of the 20th century, died on Jan. 8 in Tolochenaz, Switzerland. He was 91.

title: Tom Price Is Sworn In as Health Secretary Amid Senate Disunity
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps secretary of health and human services, Tom Price, took office on Friday with a promise to fix what he called a broken health care system that was harming Americans and their families.

title: If Obamacare Is Out, Wheres Trumpcare?
description: With President Trump in office, the goal of repealing the Affordable Care Act is finally within reach for Republicans. Margot Sanger-Katz explains why repealing and replacing Obamacare may not be easy.

title: Addiction Treatment Grew Under Health Law. Now What?
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Chad Diaz began using heroin when he was 12. Now 36 and newly covered by Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act, he is on Suboxone, a substitute opioid that eases withdrawal symptoms and cravings, and he is slowly pulling himself together.

title: Syrias Assad Sends Signals to Trump in Interview
description: President Bashar al-Assad of Syria suggested in an interview published Friday that he could foresee cooperation with the Trump administration and might even countenance the deployment of American soldiers in the country one day.

title: Campus Politics in the Age of Trump
description: LAS VEGAS  Recently, I met with a former student of mine who showed exceptional promise during his freshman year. Since he took my class, he has become a leader in social justice groups and works part time at the universitys womens center. He is now a junior and is on schedule to graduate a semester early. He is a model student. He is also undocumented.

title: Soccer and Baseball Just Cant Leave Well Enough Alone
description: Why do thriving sports feel the need to monkey around with their product? Lets take current examples from the two sports I like and know best: soccer and baseball.

title: Shopping Becomes a Political Act in the Trump Era
description: A couple of weeks ago, people boycotted Nordstrom for one reason: The department store sold Ivanka Trump products.

title: Buchi Emecheta, Nigerian Novelist, Dies at 72
description: Buchi Emecheta, a British-based Nigerian writer who, in Second-Class Citizen, The Joys of Motherhood and other novels, gave voice to African women struggling to reconcile traditional roles with the demands of modernity, died on Jan. 25 at her home in London. She was 72.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We have a very, very good bond  very, very good chemistry. Ill let you know if it changes, but I dont think it will.

title: James Dolans Garden Is Falling. Run.
description: Sometime Wednesday  as I watched Charles Oakley go face down on the Garden floor and get handcuffed, or maybe it was the next day when I read another of the Knicks presidents cryptic, emoji-laden Twitter posts that might read better if I were stoned  this thought occurred:

title: The Right Call: Yale Removes My Racist Ancestors Name From Campus
description: This article has been updated to reflect news developments.

title: Trump Will Look Into Reports That Flynn Discussed Sanctions With Russia
description: President Trump said he plans to look into reports that his national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn, discussed sanctions in his pre-inauguration conversations with Russias ambassador to the United States and possibly misled administration officials about it.

title: Conflicting Views on a Wider Police Use of DNA
description: The question of how widely investigators should be able to examine DNA databases is in the news, as officials in New York deliberate whether to authorize a method that could help find relatives of people charged with crimes.

title: Graduation Rate in New York State Hits a New High: 79.4%
description: The New York State Education Department said on Friday that the high school graduation rate hit a new high of 79.4 percent in 2016, an increase of 1.3 points from 2015 and more than 12 points from a decade ago. But changes to graduation requirements in 2016 made it hard to know whether schools were doing better or students were simply clearing a lower bar.

title: Leonard Perroots, General Who Defused Nuclear Crisis With Soviets, Dies at 83
description: In early November 1983, after President Ronald Reagan denounced the Soviet Union as the evil empire and unveiled his so-called Star Wars missile defense strategy, Kremlin leaders were growing convinced that war games planned by the United States and NATO in Western Europe were, in fact, a disguised prelude to a nuclear first strike on Russia.

title: Trump Foreign Policy Quickly Loses Its Sharp Edge
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump took a phone call from the leader of Taiwan in December and asserted that the United States might no longer be bound by the One China policy, his defenders hailed it as a show of strength  the latest delicate issue on which Mr. Trump was willing to challenge decades of diplomatic orthodoxy.

title: U.S. Blocks Palestinian Ex-Premier From Senior U.N. Post
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United States on Friday blocked the appointment of a former Palestinian official for a senior United Nations post in a move intended to signal its support for Israel and its defense of the position that there is no Palestinian state.

title: The Case of the Missing Brady Jersey
description: We have a situation, the lieutenant began.

title: An Anti-Consumer Agenda at the F.C.C.
description: As President Trump rushes to dismantle Obama-era rules that protect Americans, he has an energetic helper over at the Federal Communications Commission. Its new Republican chairman has started undoing policies of his predecessor that were intended to make phone, cable and internet service more fair and more affordable.

title: Footing the Bill for Trumps
description: All these Trumps are getting damned expensive.

title: Jeremy Scott: Fall 2017
description: Mr. Scott presents his Cult of Personality collection.

title: Americas So-Called National Security Adviser
description: From the start, Michael Flynn, a retired army lieutenant general, was a disturbing choice as President Trumps national security adviser. He is a hothead with extremist views in a critical job that is supposed to build consensus through thoughtful, prudent decision-making. The choice is now growing more unnerving every day.

title: Reports of Raids Have Immigrants Bracing for Enforcement Surge
description: In Austin, Tex., undocumented women working in a laundromat cowered in the back of the room, petrified after seeing a video and a photograph of apprehensions outside a local grocery store and burger joint.

title: The End of Caesar
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  You may have guessed that I get very excited when new entries appear in The New York Times Crossword, and you would be correct. There are a lot of things I like about solving puzzles, but seeing a fresh entry or even a brand-new clue for a ubiquitous term is like a hit of oxygen for me. If youve ever wondered how I know when that is happening, its not a matter of psychic ability (Those of you over the age of 40, please read that as  ... its not some Carnac the Magnificent-like trick), but rather the hard work of Jeff Chen and Jim Horne at XWord Info, who analyze and archive each puzzle.

title: Canada Today: An Isolated Lake and a Welcome Mat for Refugees
description: Many Canadians may dimly recall from their geography lessons that Great Bear Lake is large and somewhere up in the Northwest Territories. Fewer, however, know much more than that, and fewer still have made the trip to the lake, which straddles the Arctic Circle.

title: Help! My Constituents Are After Me!
description: Congressional Republicans are finding that constituents, like facts, are stubborn things.

title: Strong Quake Strikes Southern Philippines, Killing at Least 6
description: MANILA  At least six people were killed and more than 100 others were injured when an earthquake struck the southern Philippines late Friday, a disaster management official said on Saturday.

title: While Testy Fans Make a Stand, Knicks Do Not
description: Greg Armstrong was conflicted on Friday morning. He has owned Knicks season tickets for 25 years, and he makes the trek from Middletown, N.Y., for about 30 games each year. He has raised his children in this fandom.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Alec Baldwin Hosts Saturday Night Live
description: Alec Baldwin, who has made headlines with his impersonation of President Trump on Saturday Night Live, returns to host for a 17th time. And the violinist Joshua Bell plays with the National Symphony Orchestra.

title: Corrections: February 11, 2017
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Jimmy Carter: From Peanuts to Solar Panels
description: Former President Jimmy Carter, 92, unveiled a solar energy project to help power his hometown. While President Trump has depicted himself as a champion of coal, Mr. Carters project aims to be a model for energy self-sufficiency and job growth.

title: Hell Hath No Fury Like a Woman Warned
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: All Joking Aside, Heres How Sean Spicer Shook Up the White House Press Briefing
description: Mr. Spicer typically calls on media organizations outside the mainstream before getting to more traditional news outlets.

title: Trying to Minimize the Misery of Mug Shots
description: The Haggler has a spotless criminal record. Of course, that is because the Haggler is a fictional construct, which means he has no wrists, and this makes him impossible to handcuff. Here we have a key difference between the Haggler and the bumbling nitwit whose name is affixed to this column. He has wrists. Has he ever been arrested? Nobody cares. And the Haggler doesnt know because he and the nitwit are barely on speaking terms.

title: Jimmy Carter Makes a Stand for Solar, Decades After the Cardigan Sweater
description: PLAINS, Ga.  The solar panels  3,852 of them  shimmered above 10 acres of Jimmy Carters soil where peanuts and soybeans used to grow. The panels moved almost imperceptibly with the sun. And they could power more than half of this small town, from which Mr. Carter rose from obscurity to the presidency.

title: Goats, Alpacas and (of Course) a Hen: Life on a Hobby Farm
description: Suzie Conn, a longtime advertising executive from Nashville, had never even seen an alpaca until moving to the country and showing up at a county fair.

title: Hes Little in the Film Moonlight, but Big on the Dodgeball Court
description: LOS ANGELES  Alex R. Hibbert eyed a group of six children whipping red and yellow balls at one another in a large, reverberant pit made with trampoline floors and walls. He wanted in. But one player needed to get nailed by a ball and knocked out of the game first. He stood in line, his feet fidgeting, before bailing. He ran over to a nearby trampoline, pulled up his hoodie, crouched down and launched himself first upward and then backward into a flip.

title: How a Top Model Also Became an Intersex Activist
description: One of the models starring in Alexander Wangs show on Saturday on West 146th Street  a model who, with her I-dare-you blue-eyed stare and power stomp, is one of the most familiar faces on the runway  recently took on a new daytime gig. Not actress. Not brand ambassador.

title: Move Over, Wikipedia. Dictionaries Are Hot Again.
description: In the hours after Senator Elizabeth Warren, Democrat of Massachusetts, was silenced by her Republican colleagues for impugning a fellow senator by reading aloud a letter Coretta Scott King had written that was critical of Jeff Sessions, Republican of Alabama (later confirmed as attorney general), thousands of Americans did what they always do: They tapped away at their phones.

title: A Palm Beach Power Hostess Prepares for Trumps Washington
description: Every presidential administration needs a grande dame to smooth relations between rival factions and serve as a bridge to society. In the 1970s and 80s, Sally Quinn, then married to Benjamin C. Bradlee, executive editor of The Washington Post, was known for the high-I.Q. salons held at their Georgetown townhouse. Roughly a decade later, Georgette Mosbacher, a cosmetics executive and philanthropist, became Washingtons hostess supreme as a result of the round-table dinner parties she hosted with her then-husband, the oil tycoon turned commerce secretary Robert A. Mosbacher.

title: More Women in Their 60s and 70s Are Having Way Too Much Fun to Retire
description: Kay Abramowitz has been working, with a few breaks, since she was 14. Now 76, she is a partner in a law firm in Portland, Ore.  with no intention of stopping anytime soon. Retirement or death is always on the horizon, but I have no plans, she said. Im actually having way too much fun.

title: Lena Dunham and Judd Apatow on Girls, Geeks and Trolls
description: If you ever have to tell a famous actress (and writer, director and producer) that her nipple is showing five minutes after photography has begun, hope that its Lena Dunham.

title: New Services for Travelers, From Fitness to Food
description: There is no shortage today of new apps and services aimed at making travel more convenient, even pleasurable. Here, four of the latest contenders worth checking out:

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: All Trump, All the Time
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Are There Laws to Limit Excessive Light?
description: Q. I live in a small walk-up in Park Slope, Brooklyn. My bedroom windows face a six-story condominium. Those  windows are about 50 feet from six floor-to-ceiling glass walls in front of hallways. The building keeps fluorescent lights on in all six hallways all night long, creating a 60-foot-tall wall of light bright enough to make it look like the sun is shining into my bedroom at midnight. I hung light-blocking curtains and put black construction paper in my windows, which make the room dark enough to sleep. But is it legal for a building to create such an excessive amount of light pollution?

title: How to Get the (Very Exclusive) Blue Mascara From Jason Wu
description: While the bright orange-red lip at Jason Wus fall/winter 2017 presentation was full of high-impact energy, it wasnt the most compelling part of the beauty look. Instead, a subtle  but significant  flick of cobalt mascara generated quite a commotion backstage. Its a bit of Great Lash in Royal Blue, said the makeup artist Yadim, name-checking the cult-classic shade that Maybelline discontinued in 2014 and makeup obsessives have been tracking ever since. Its appearance in Yadims kit, however, confirmed that the brand will, in fact, release it again: It will hit shelves this spring (May, to be exact).

title: After Work, Down on the Farm
description: Remaining active and productive  and indulging a passion  are a few of the reasons more retirees are setting up small farms around the country.

title: A Sense of Dread for Civil Servants Shaken by Trump Transition
description: WASHINGTON  Across the vast federal bureaucracy, Donald J. Trumps arrival in the White House has spread anxiety, frustration, fear and resistance among many of the two million nonpolitical civil servants who say they work for the public, not a particular president.

title: A Star at the Apollo, Out of Its Spotlight
description: Every Sunday in February, we will feature and explore previously unpublished photographs from The New York Timess archives, with a special focus on the 1960s. Revisit last years Unpublished Black History project, sign up for our Race/Related newsletter and share your own experiences with black history in the comments.

title: Chinese-Indonesian Governors Struggles Worry Some in His Ethnic Group
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  It was Chinese New Year, which at Ryan Gozalis household usually involves eating an elaborate banquet while younger relatives are nagged about when theyre getting married.

title: State G.O.P. Leaders Move Swiftly as Party Bickers in Congress
description: When Republicans in Kentucky seized total control of the state government last year, Damon Thayer, the majority leader in the State Senate, began asking around for advice from counterparts in other capitals where the party already dominated both the legislative and executive branches.

title: Raymond Smullyan, Puzzle-Creating Logician, Dies at 97
description: Raymond Smullyan, whose merry, agile mind led him to be a musician, a magician, a mathematician and, most cunningly, a puzzle-creating logician, died on Monday in Hudson, N.Y. He was 97.

title: Peter Mansfield, M.R.I. Pioneer and Nobel Laureate, Dies at 83
description: Sir Peter Mansfield, who shared a Nobel Prize for discoveries that underpinned the invention of magnetic resonance imaging, the method of peering inside the human body that revolutionized medicine, died on Wednesday. He was 83.

title: Fashion Shows: Calvin Klein, Jason Wu and Jeremy Scott
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2017 collections that were presented in New York on Friday.

title: Variety: Vowelless Crossword
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Why has it taken me so long to fall in love with vowelless crosswords? Most likely because I have a general policy of avoidance, but no longer.

title: NATO Checking Claim that U.S. Airstrikes Killed 22 Afghan Civilians
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The NATO mission in Afghanistan has opened a preliminary investigation into claims that more than 20 civilians were killed in recent American airstrikes in the southern province of Helmand, military officials said Saturday.

title: Losing Hope in U.S., Migrants Make Icy Crossing to Canada
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba  Almost three months after Bashir Yussuf watched Donald J. Trump win the presidential election, he made his way to Noyes, Minn., where he set off at night into the snow-filled woods and crawled across the unmarked border into Canada.

title: Lacoste: Fall 2017
description: The label shows its fall designs.

title: For Kushner, Israel Policy May Be Shaped by the Personal
description: When Jared Kushner was 17 years old, he stood where a million Jews had been murdered and listened to Israels prime minister stress the countrys importance.

title: Even for Home Games, the Coach Is Away
description: Sue DeBoer circled this Sunday on the kitchen calendar inside her Madison, N.J., home months ago.

title: Spywares Odd Targets: Backers of Mexicos Soda Tax
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Last summer, Dr. Simn Barqueras phone started buzzing with a series of disturbing text messages from unknown numbers. One said his daughter had been in a serious accident. Another claimed to be from a friend whose father had died  with a link to funeral details.

title: Large Birds, Hungry Tigers and Other Puzzles
description: Raymond M. Smullyan, a mathematician who died recently, often met people who said they hated math, and yet they loved his logic puzzles. Can you solve this sampling?

title: Is a Job at the White House Right for You?
description: Theres only one way to find out: Apply!

title: Erdogan Curbs Criticism of Trump, Seeking Warmer Relationship
description: ANKARA, Turkey  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey and the officials around him rarely miss a chance to call out Western hostility toward Islam.

title: Will We Lose the Doctor Who Would Stop the Next Flint?
description: FLINT, Mich.  Eighteen months ago, as a pediatrician here, I discovered that the untreated tap water corroding the citys plumbing was poisoning our children with lead. State officials called my science faulty and accused me of creating hysteria. But I was right and persisted, and with brave parents, pastors, journalists and scientists demanded answers until this continuing public health disaster was finally acknowledged. An entire city, with about 10,000 young children, was unnecessarily exposed to lead, a neurotoxin that causes irreversible brain damage. The corrosive water also likely caused the deaths of a dozen people from Legionnaires disease. Flint remains traumatized.

title: Gorsuch Not Easy to Pigeonhole on Gay Rights, Friends Say
description: WASHINGTON  Phil Berg was nervous as he prepared to tell Neil Gorsuch he was gay.

title: In Neil Gorsuchs Confirmations, Parsing the Meaning of Yes
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump formally nominated Judge Neil M. Gorsuch to the Supreme Court, he boasted that Judge Gorsuch had been confirmed by the Senate to his current appeals court position by a unanimous vote more than decade ago.

title: Creatures of the wind: Fall 2017
description: Shane Gabier and Chris Peters show their fall looks.

title: As Spring Training Nears, a Look at Baseballs Window Treatment
description: Its such an inviting word: window. Just look at those first three letters. Everyone wants to win, right? As spring training opens this week, in Florida and Arizona, theres powerful symbolism in opening a window to a new season, drinking in the blue sky and dreaming of the best.

title: Trumps Economic Cabinet Is Mostly Bare. This Man Fills the Void.
description: A few weeks after the election, Gary Cohn, the president of Goldman Sachs, was summoned to Trump Tower for a discussion about the economy. It would be the first of many such meetings with President-elect Donald J. Trump.

title: Yale Will Drop John Calhouns Name From Building
description: After a swelling tide of protests, the president of Yale announced on Saturday that the university would change the name of a residential college commemorating John C. Calhoun, the 19th-century white supremacist statesman from South Carolina. The college will be renamed for Grace Murray Hopper, a trailblazing computer scientist and Navy rear admiral who received a masters degree and a doctorate from Yale.

title: Judge, Jury, Executioner, President
description: You have certainly heard of Bowe Bergdahl  the American soldier captured by the Taliban after he left his post in Afghanistan, the subject of the second season of the podcast Serial and the recurring object, during the presidential campaign, of Donald J. Trumps ire.

title: Republicans Hold On to a Myth to Hold On to Power
description: Given the increased political power Republicans won in the last elections, from Washington to red-state legislatures, voters might expect the party to feel that the nations voting procedures are working quite well. Yet this is far from the case, as triumphant Republicans are using their enhanced clout to continue their campaign playing up the mythical threat that voter fraud abounds in the nation.

title: Are Democrats Falling Into Trumps Trap?
description: In one of many recent forums for the politicians vying to lead the Democratic National Committee  and, ideally, the party  out of the wilderness and into better times, the candidates were asked to distill the importance of fighting Donald Trump to 10 words or less.

title: Husbands Are Deadlier Than Terrorists
description: With the President Trump Reality Show, its easy to be distracted by ANGRY ALL-CAPITAL TWEETS or Oval Office tantrums. But resist, and stay focused on matters of life and death.

title: Trump Says Refugees Are Flooding U.S. in Misleading Allusion
description: JUPITER, Fla.  President Trump said on Saturday that judicial decisions that halted his executive order banning travel from seven predominantly Muslim countries had allowed a flood of refugees to pour into the country.

title: Ryan Roche: Fall 2017
description: Ms. Roche show her latest collection.

title: Trumps Gold Lining
description: Listen up, haters.

title: Can This Presidency Be Saved?
description: The peak of Donald Trumps presidency, so far and perhaps forever, happened before he became the president. It was the deal he struck with Carrier, the Indiana air-conditioning company, to keep a factory open and jobs in the United States. No moment was so triumphantly Trumpian; nothing has gone as well for him since.

title: How We Overcame Tyranny Before
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  From my home here, I look up at the immense mountain range of the Andes and my spirits are lifted. Since my childhood, these mountains have bestowed on me a sense of security and permanence sadly absent from my life, but in these troubling times, they afford me something else: an intimation of hope.

title: Calvin Klein, Fendi and W Magazine Hold Parties for Fashion Week
description: On Friday night, the fashion flock headed to parties for a new Fendi app, Raf Simonss debut collection for Calvin Klein and the return of Fiorucci.

title: Calvin Klein, Fendi and W Magazine Hold Parties for Fashion Week
description: On Friday night, after the last runway show ended, the fashion flock headed to the South Street Seaport for a party celebrating F is For ... , a new app-slash-website from Fendi. Guests included Teyana Taylor, the floor-thumping star of Kanye Wests Fade music video. Who doesnt love Fendi? Its always the greatest, she said. I have Wang tomorrow and then I finish my album.

title: Retirement Advice in the Trump Era
description: A federal judge in Texas did President Trump a favor last week. It came in a decision in a case filed by the financial industry against the Labor Department to overturn an Obama-era regulation called the fiduciary rule, which requires financial advisers to put their clients interests first when giving advice and selling investments for retirement accounts.

title: Peaceful Protests Are Not a Crime
description: A bit of silver lining at the onset of the Trump administration has been the groundswell of activism by hundreds of thousands of Americans taking to the streets to face off against a president, and a Republican establishment, they see as reckless, divisive and destructive.

title: Caitlyn Jenners Mission
description: Donald Trumps inauguration was devoid of stars. Elton John said no. Justin Timberlake cried the president a river. The event was barren of A-listers. Except for one.

title: Stephen Miller Is a True Believer Behind Core Trump Policies
description: WASHINGTON  Staff members on Capitol Hill recall Stephen Miller, the 31-year-old White House adviser behind many of President Trumps most contentious executive orders, as the guy from Jeff Sessionss office who made their inboxes cry for mercy.

title: Since When Is Being a Woman a Liberal Cause?
description: Who gets to define what it means to be pro-women? The left has staked its claim. The public face of resistance to President Trump began with a womens march. An estimated three to five million turned out worldwide, brandishing signs like Womens Rights Are Not Up for Grabs to deliver the message that to be a woman was to be against this president.

title: Imagining Melanias Fashion Line
description: What would the clothes look like?

title: A Rising Golfer Carries Her Own Clubs, and Her Head High
description: Nicole Broch Larsen is probably not discussing much about yardage and lines with her caddie this weekend at the Vic Open in Barwon Heads, Australia.

title: Israel Bulldozes Democracy
description: HAIFA, Israel  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is expected to visit Washington this week to meet with President Trump, presumably to discuss the political philosophy they share: power through hate and fear. A government that bars refugees and Muslims from entering the United States has much in common with one that permits Israeli settlers to steal land from Palestinians, as a new law that Mr. Netanyahus coalition pushed through Parliament last week did.

title: American Identity
description: History may be a continuing argument, but we dont lack for a shared historical narrative.

title: Alison Herlands and Michael Chessa: Law and Order and Love
description: Alison Beth Herlands and Michael John Chessa were married Feb. 11 at the Loeb Boathouse in Central Park. Rabbi Rachel Timoner officiated.

title: Emma Ludbrook and Tom Windish: Their First Date Was a Big Production
description: Emma Ludbrook and Tom Windish were married Feb. 10 at the MacArthur, an event space in Los Angeles. Jared Leto, the actor and singer-songwriter, who is a friend of the couple, became a Universal Life minister for the occasion to officiate.

title: Bernhard Langer, 59, Is Still at the Top of His Game
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  There is a running joke among players on the PGA Tour Champions that their best chance of derailing the dominant Bernhard Langer is his risk of a back injury from hauling away all his trophies.

title: Do the Splits
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Lynn Lempel is affectionately known as one of the Queens of Mondays in crosswordland because she has published so many early week, joyous-to-solve grids, but once in a while she mixes it up and delivers a Sunday.

title: Anti-Abortion Activists Call on Trump for Support
description: More than 200 protests took place at Planned Parenthood locations across the country, urging the president and the Congress to strip federal funding from the women's health provider. Supporters of the organization held more than 150 counter-demonstrations.

title: Christian Siriano: Fall 2017
description: Mr. Sirianos fall looks.

title: Miles Cahn, Co-Founder of Coach Handbags, Dies at 95
description: Miles Cahn, who with his wife founded the Coach Leatherware Company, which helped redefine the American handbag as both chic and practical, died on Friday at his home in Manhattan. He was 95.

title: Trump Drops Defense of Obama Guidelines on Transgender Students
description: A nationwide injunction that has kept transgender students from using school bathrooms and other facilities that correspond with their gender identity will remain in place after the Trump administration decided not to challenge it in court. The move, announced Friday, ended an effort mounted by the Obama administration after the order was announced last year.

title: Harvey Lichtenstein, Who Led Brooklyn Academy of Musics Rebirth, Dies at 87
description: Harvey Lichtenstein, who transformed a moribund Brooklyn Academy of Music into a dynamic showcase for cutting-edge performing arts and its Fort Greene neighborhood into a cultural hub during his 32 years there as the executive producer, died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: A Presidential Golf Outing, With a Twist: Trump Owns the Place
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  Black plastic covered the doors and windows in an ornate suite at one of President Trumps resorts on Saturday, as he bonded with Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan over a round of golf on a pristine day.

title: Dogs and Cats Together. Hold the Mass Hysteria.
description: When word spread late last month that cats would be joining the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show, internet outrage fed off confusion about whether the show, one of the worlds premier animal competitions, was about to become a mongrel event.

title: 6 Things You Missed From Day 3 of Fashion Week
description: Saturday was a relatively quiet day for Fashion Week, a lull before the packed schedules of Sunday and Monday. It stood in stark contrast to Friday night, which was jampacked with parties thrown by Fendi, Calvin Klein, Jeremy Scott and W Magazine.

title: North Korea Fires Ballistic Missile, Challenging Trump
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea launched a ballistic missile toward the sea off its eastern coast on Sunday, in what South Korea called the Norths first attempt to test President Trumps policy on the isolated country.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Progressives cannot afford to forget about whats happening in our backyards. Some of it is even more egregious than what is currently happening in Washington, D.C.

title: Cats Join Dogs for a Show
description: Cats clawed their way into an event preceding the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show.

title: Rangers Goaltender Henrik Lundqvist Collects his 400th Regular-Season Victory
description: Rangers goaltender Henrik Lundqvist won his 400th career regular-season game Saturday night, defeating the Colorado Avalanche, 4-2, at Madison Square Garden.

title: Alexander Wang: Fall 2017
description: Mr. Wangs fall collection.

title: D.N.C. Contenders Agree on One Thing: Resistance to Trump
description: BALTIMORE  The outpouring of protests across the country has scrambled the contest for chairman of the Democratic National Committee two weeks before the vote, as party activists thrash out who should be the face of a newly energized party.

title: Corrections: February 12, 2017
description: SPORTS

title: Marian Golden, Andrew Bongiovanni
description: Marian Louise Reynolds Golden and Andrew Joseph Bongiovanni were married Feb. 11 at 501 Union, an event space in Brooklyn. Sarah Sheikh, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Caitlin Dempsey, Robert Gambo
description: Caitlin Lee Dempsey and Robert Theodore Gambo were married Feb. 11 at the Harold Pratt House, an event space in New York. The Rev. Noel Clarke, a priest affiliated with CITI Ministries, led the ceremony.

title: Lauren Perlgut, Benjamin Holzman
description: Lauren Beth Perlgut and Benjamin Ari Holzman were married Feb. 11 at Chelsea Piers in New York. Cantor Lisa Arbisser officiated.

title: Jennifer Merrill, Dhruva Rajendra
description: Jennifer Laura Merrill and Dhruva Kumar Rajendra were married Feb. 6 at their home in Bethesda, Md., where Eric Koester, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Mary Cunningham, Matthew Ogren
description: Mary Kate Cunningham and Matthew Garland Ogren were married Feb. 11 at the McCormick Ranch Golf Club in Scottsdale, Ariz. The Rev. James Egbert, who was ordained by the Christian Universalist Association, officiated.

title: Eileen Ahasic, Ian Bierig
description: Eileen Rose Ahasic and Ian Alexander Harper Bierig were married Feb. 11 at the Conrad B. Duberstein Courthouse in Brooklyn. Chief Judge Carla E. Craig of the bankruptcy division of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York officiated.

title: Riva Margolis, Brett Hayden
description: Riva Rose Margolis and Dr. Brett Laurence Hayden were married Feb. 11 at Tribeca Rooftop, an event space in Manhattan. Rabbi Lester Bronstein led the ceremony.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Grammys, Girls and John Oliver
description: James Corden, he of the viral car-pool karaoke sessions, takes on the job of hosting this years Grammy Awards. On HBO, Girls returns for its final season, and Last Week Tonight With John Oliver is back for the first time since the week after the election.

title: Meryl Streep Pledges to Stand Up to Brownshirts in Tirade Against Trump
description: Meryl Streep, in a fiery speech criticizing President Trump on Saturday night, pledged to stand up against brownshirts and bots at a time when she and others are increasingly denouncing his administrations policies and the president himself.

title: A Test of Endurance for Drivers and Fans
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla.  Twenty-four hours. One thousand four hundred forty minutes. Eighty-six thousand four hundred seconds.

title: On S.N.L., Alec Baldwin and Melissa McCarthy Take On Trump and Sean Spicer
description: It took nearly an hour for Alec Baldwin, this weekends host of Saturday Night Live and its resident impersonator of President Trump, to don a certain familiar orange wig and assume the role that has occasionally infuriated the current real-life occupant of the Oval Office. In the meantime, S.N.L. took plenty of satirical shots at the Trump administration, starting with the return of Melissa McCarthy as the White House press secretary, Sean Spicer.

title: Review: S.N.L. Targets Trump Again, With a Hint of Exhaustion
description: If President Trumps shock-and-awe attack on truth, decorum and liberal sensibilities is intended to bludgeon his opponents into submission, Saturday Night Live felt like his latest victim this weekend.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: 211 West 71st Street, No. 5C, Upper West Side

title: How Beyonc Could Make Grammy History Tonight
description: A look at Beyoncs Grammy Awards compared to the ceremonys top winners since 1959.

title: Trumps Cabinet, Refugee Ban, Grammys: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Adele Dominates the Grammys; Beyonc Stops the Show
description: Adele won album of the year for 25 and both record of the year and song of the year for Hello.

title: After Gun Battle in Kashmir, Protests Turn Violent
description: NEW DELHI  Indian security forces in Kashmir engaged in an intense, 12-hour-long gun battle with militants that ended late Sunday morning, leaving four militants, two soldiers and one civilian dead, the authorities said. An additional civilian died after a protest.

title: Lots of Eyeliner (and No After-Party) at Alexander Wang
description: Its a bit nocturnal, said Diane Kendal of the onyx-rimmed eyeliner look she created for Alexander Wangs fall/winter 2017 show, held at the RKO Hamilton Theater in Harlem. This kind of girl, she said, has been out all night partying, having a good time.

title: World War II Bomb Removal in Greece Forces 72,000 From Homes
description: ATHENS  In Greeces biggest peacetime evacuation ever, about 72,000 people left their homes in the city of Thessaloniki on Sunday as experts defused and removed a World War II bomb from below a gas station.

title: 9 Million Desserts, for Gabriel, Michael, Alessandra and More
description: If the first step in Chuck Piekarskis spice cake recipe sounds ordinary  blend together margarine and sugar until they are well combined  the quantities are not: 18 pounds of margarine and 120 cups of sugar. And, eventually, 18 quarts of eggs, 198 cups of all-purpose flour, 30 cups of vegetable oil, 16 cups of molasses, 63 tablespoons of baking powder and 15 quarts of milk.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Fashion Shows: Alexander Wang, Lacoste, Creatures of the Wind, Ryan Roche
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2017 collections that were presented in New York on Saturday.

title: 52 Places to Go: Zermatt
description: Zermatt, Switzerland, offers spectacular views of the Matterhorn from every angle. Come hit the slopes in the Alps.

title: Victoria Beckham: Fall 2017
description: Ms. Beckham shows her fall looks.

title: Canadas Conservatives Seek a Champion, and Redemption
description: OTTAWA  Canadas Conservatives need a way back.

title: Fifty Shades Darker Submits to Lego Batman
description: LOS ANGELES  Three movies aimed at starkly different audiences made North American multiplexes hum over the weekend, as The Lego Batman Movie brought out families, John Wick: Chapter Two reeled in young men and the kinky sex thriller Fifty Shades Darker appealed to  well, you know who you are.

title: Hamilton and Harry Potter Productions Try to Outwit Scalpers
description: LONDON  Hamilton and the new Harry Potter play are the hottest theatrical shows of the moment, with Hamilton outgrossing everything else on Broadway, and Harry, Hermione and Ron drawing hordes of muggles to Londons West End.

title: Fashions Betsy DeVos Connection
description: It was an eventful week for the DeVos family of Grand Rapids, Mich. On Tuesday, Vice President Mike Pence cast the tiebreaking vote, confirming Betsy DeVos as the Trump administrations Secretary of Education.

title: Public School: Fall 2017
description: Dao-Yi Chow and Maxwell Osborne show their fall womens collection.

title: Immigration Raids Set Off Protests
description: A recent wave of immigration roundups prompted protests in several American cities, although officials at Immigration and Customs Enforcement said the crackdown that people were seeing did not represent an increased tempo.

title: Top Opposition Leader in Cambodia Resigns as Election Nears
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  The embattled leader of Cambodias main opposition party abruptly quit on Saturday in the face of increasing government pressure, ceding a political stage he had occupied for more than two decades.

title: Klimt Landscape Bauerngarten Could Bring $45 Million
description: The auction house Sothebys has announced that Bauerngarten, a dazzling 1907 landscape painting by the Viennese modernist Gustav Klimt, will lead its Impressionist and Modern Art sale on March 1, in London. This marks the first time in more than two decades that the oil painting has been offered at auction, where it is expected to fetch in excess of $45 million.

title: Donald Trump, North Korea, Kashmir: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Angela Merkel, Squeezed by Far Right, Now Faces a Rising Left
description: BERLIN  She is considered the indispensable European, yet one of the biggest questions looming over the Continents crucial elections this year is whether Germany still regards Angela Merkel as indispensable, too.

title: Subways Slide in Performance Leaves Straphangers Fuming
description: Subway riders in New York City have become increasingly angry about the quality of service. Their fury is justified.

title: Al Jarreau, Singer Who Spanned Jazz, Pop and R&B Worlds, Dies at 76
description: Al Jarreau, a versatile vocalist who sold millions of records and won a string of Grammys for his work in pop and R&B as well as his first love, jazz, died on Sunday in Los Angeles. He was 76.

title: Charges in Karina Vetranos Death Leave Suspects Parents Shaken
description: The retired schoolteacher hung the first poster board in his living room long ago, a record of achievements that filled him with pride: education certificates from his native Jamaica and New York City; a 1970s magazine article about new teachers that begins, Richard Lewis: dashing, debonair, youthful and energetic.

title: Tome: Fall 2017
description: Ryan Lobo and Ramon Martins fall looks.

title: Trump Sons Forge Ahead Without Father, Expanding and Navigating Conflicts
description: President Trumps old office on the 26th floor of Trump Tower in Manhattan sits unoccupied now, unofficial storage space for the gathering trove of memorabilia that his two oldest sons say they hope will eventually be turned over to their fathers presidential library.

title: ASAP Bari, Virgil Abloh and Jonathan Simkhai Party on Saturday Night of Fashion Week
description: Celebrations were held for Jonathan Simkhais lastest collection, and a sneaker collaboration between Nike and VLONE.

title: Gypsy Sport: Fall 2017
description: Rio Uribe presents his latest designs.

title: Netanyahus Meeting With Trump to Set Tone for U.S.-Israel Relations
description: JERUSALEM  As President Trump appeared to shift closer to the political center on several contentious policies on Israel, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu suggested on Sunday that it was unrealistic to expect their two countries to agree completely on all issues.

title: Worlds Diplomats, Seeking a Bridge to Trump, Look to Haley
description: UNITED NATIONS  The shock is gone. Panic is subsiding. Now, diplomats who represent the nations of the world are entering what one described as the third stage of grief: figuring out how to deal with President Trump.

title: How to Get the Glowing Skin at Victoria Beckham
description: Its a simple start to the morning, the lead makeup artist Pat McGrath said jokingly, backstage at Victoria Beckhams fall/winter 2017 runway show this morning. She was referring to the chic, sophisticated, intelligent woman she channeled for this seasons beauty look, built upon a canvas of gorgeously luminescent skin. In reality, achieving that perfect base was far from simple.

title: For Democrats, Being Out of Power Has Its Perks
description: BALTIMORE  There is something liberating about not being in charge.

title: Williamstown Theater Fest Announces Lineup
description: The emerging playwright Jen Silvermans The Roommate will kick off this summers Williamstown Theater Festival. The play pairs Jane Kaczmarek (Malcolm in the Middle) and S. Epatha Merkerson (Law & Order) as two women whose divergent backgrounds frustrate and illuminate when they move in together. (More of Ms. Silvermans work can be seen starting Feb. 27, when her Bront-inspired play The Moors makes its New York premiere at the Duke, on 42nd Street.)

title: Activism Hits Even the Less Flashy Tech Companies
description: SAN FRANCISCO  As soon as President Trump signed his executive order on immigration, some of the biggest tech companies went quiet. Their executives did not sign legal briefs, brandish statements or dissent on Twitter. They strove for business as usual.

title: Baby in a Box? Free Cardboard Bassinets Encourage Safe Sleeping
description: CAMDEN, N.J.  Jernica Quiones, a mother of five, was the first parent in New Jersey to get her free baby box  a portable, low-tech bassinet made of laminated cardboard. But first, she had to take an online course about safe sleeping practices, which experts say can sharply reduce the chances of sudden infant death syndrome.

title: China, the Party-Corporate Complex
description: There, they said it: China is not a market economy.

title: Before You Take the Trip: How About a Virtual Test Drive?
description: From raising money for St. Jude Childrens Research Hospital to rolling out a new airline business class service, travel companies and tourism boards are increasingly turning to virtual reality to expand their reach and entice prospective clients.

title: Grammy Winners 2017
description: The complete list of winners:

title: Trump Criticized Obama for Golfing. Now He Spends Weekends on the Links.
description: As a private citizen, Donald J. Trump was repeatedly critical of President Obamas fondness for relaxing with a round of golf.

title: What Is the State of Your Block in New York City?
description: (Leer en espaol)

title: Heng on Trumps Asia Policy
description: What will the new presidents approach mean for China and the rest of Asia?

title: Off the Runway: New York Fashion Week Day 2
description: Scenes from the Kate Spade and Tanya Taylor presentations on Day 2 of New York Fashion Week.

title: Review: An Old Ballet Is Kissed Into New Life
description: MIAMI  Alexei Ratmanskys latest ballet, The Fairys Kiss, feels like skillful, page-turning prose that opens in each scene into different forms of poetry. Its also a completely clear piece of storytelling, carrying the audience through the four scenes of Igor Stravinskys fast-changing 1928 score Le Baiser de la Fe. (The music abounds in Stravinskys arrangements of items by Tchaikovsky, to whom its dedicated.)

title: Off the Runway: New York Fashion Week Day 2
description: Our photographers captured the action backstage and between the shows on the second day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Review: A Tenor and a Soprano Make I Puritani Gleam at the Met
description: There are serious downsides to the Metropolitan Operas revival of Bellinis I Puritani, which opened on Friday. The companys 1976 Sandro Sequi production is dustier-looking and duller than ever, and the conductor Maurizio Benini, a Met regular in the bel canto repertory, led a surprisingly limp and colorless performance of this lyrically sublime and elegant score.

title: Review: Igor Levit, a Pianist for Polarizing Times
description: As we filed out after the pianist Igor Levits hypnotic Carnegie Hall debut recital on Friday evening, a friend made a little musical joke. There wasnt a note of mezzo-forte in there, he said, meaning that Mr. Levit hadnt much bothered with the space between very loud and very soft.

title: Off the Runway: New York Fashion Week Day 4
description: Moments from the shows of TOME, Marcel Ostertag and Chloe Gosselin on the fourth day of New York Fashion Week.

title: These Dogs Feel Like Warm Bologna. Their Fans Say Bald Is Beautiful.
description: Anyone who has ever watched the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show knows how important it is for a dog to have a proper hairstyle.

title: Off the Runway: New York Fashion Week Day 4
description: New York Fashion Week didnt pause for winter weather. Our photographers captured the action backstage and between the shows.

title: Neil Gaiman on His Norse Mythology, in Which Odin Wants a Wall
description: Neil Gaiman was reading to a packed crowd from his new book of stories, Norse Mythology, on Thursday night at Town Hall, and he had 15 tales to choose from. He picked one called The Master Builder.

title: Switzerland Votes to Ease Citizenship for Third-Generation Immigrants
description: GENEVA  The posters seen in several cities and provinces featured two very similar young women: both born in Switzerland, educated in Swiss schools, now in their 20s and working full time in Swiss jobs. They even share the given name Vanessa.

title: In Humans, if You Need a Marriage Counselor, See a Robot
description: Humans, the drama about human-robot relations co-produced by AMC and Channel 4 in Britain, aired its first season to modest notice in 2015. Then, like many technologies, it was eclipsed by a new model. When HBOs Westworld  more cinematic, starring bigger names  followed in 2016, Humans became the Zune to the Westworld iPod.

title: Into a Blue Evening Sky
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  I had two thoughts about todays debut by Brent Sverdloff (with his collaborator, Michael Blake): The first was Oh man, its another vowel progression and the second one was Hey, we havent seen one of these in a while. I can handle this frequency of vowel progression themes.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Feb. 13
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Head of Spains Far-Left Party Survives Leadership Challenge
description: MADRID  Pablo Iglesias, the head of Spains far-left Podemos Party, defeated a challenge in a leadership vote on Sunday, giving him a strong mandate to stick with the radical line that has made Podemos one of Europes main anti-establishment parties.

title: The Grammys Red Carpet 2017
description: Check out what Adele, Ro James, Tinashe and more wore on the music industrys biggest night. Updating with expected nominees like Beyonc, Justin Bieber and Rihanna.

title: The Grammys Red Carpet 2017
description: Check out what Adele, Rihanna, Jennifer Lopez and more wore on the music industrys biggest night.

title: Trump Responds to North Korean Missile Launch With Uncharacteristic Restraint
description: WASHINGTON  After North Korea threatened on New Years Day to test an intercontinental ballistic missile, Donald J. Trump, then president-elect, reacted with characteristic swagger. He vowed to stop the North from developing a nuclear weapon capable of hitting the United States. It wont happen! he wrote on Twitter.

title: Asian Tech Titans Take a Page From Trumps Book
description: HONG KONG  In his book on deal making, President Trump offered a key piece of advice on getting what you want: Promise big.

title: Turmoil at the National Security Council, From the Top Down
description: Over the weekend, The Times published this investigation into the agency that Michael T. Flynn was leading before he stepped down. Read our updated article on Mr. Flynns resignation.

title: G.O.P. Lawmakers Like What They See in Trump. They Just Have to Squint.
description: WASHINGTON  Republican congressional aides have set their iPhones to flutter every time President Trump hurls a thunderbolt on Twitter. Senators nod politely at his false claims of mass voter fraud during private White House meetings. The congressional morning briefing literature now includes a rundown of overnight and early-morning social media missives from the commander in chief.

title: With Everything About Trump, Whats a Designer to Do?
description: The night President and Mrs. Trump had dinner at Mar-a-Lago with Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan and his wife, Akie Abe  after a nice round of golf and a garden tour, before North Korea necessitated an impromptu news conference  Alexander Wang dragged his audience up to the crumbling abandoned RKO Hamilton Theater on 146th Street in Harlem and jammed everyone into a standing-room-only area that once housed orchestra seats and now framed a raised runway.

title: Migrating North, but to Mexico, Not the U.S.
description: SALTILLO, Mexico  Wendy no longer worries that when her sons leave the apartment in the morning, they may never make it to school. Memories of the gangs that haunted their lives in Honduras are slowly receding into the past.

title: Republicans, Aiming to Kill Health Law, Also Work to Shore It Up
description: WASHINGTON  After denouncing the Affordable Care Act as an abomination for seven years, Republicans in Congress, working with the Trump administration, are urgently seeking ways to shore up health insurance marketplaces created by the law.

title: La La Land Wins Five Baftas, Continuing Its Oscar Momentum
description: LONDON  La La Land scooped up five EE British Academy Film Awards, or Baftas, on Sunday, adding some fuel to its fire as it marches toward what is viewed as a likely victory at the Oscars later this month.

title: With More Muscle, Mets Syndergaard Envisions an Even Faster Fastball
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The Mets success this season will hinge, in large part, on the health of several key players, particularly in the teams starting rotation. In managing the return of pitchers Jacob deGrom, Matt Harvey, Steve Matz and Zack Wheeler from arm ailments, the Mets will undoubtedly rely on starter Noah Syndergaard, who had only minor problems last season and became the teams workhorse.

title: Lou Gehrigs Fixer-Upper Awaits a Buyer for the Long Run
description: The Iron Horse had brass fixtures in his house. And galvanized steel wiring. He also had clapboard siding, parquet floors and a screened-in porch.

title: Ex-Athletes Battle for Scholarship Upgrades: I Feel Like I Helped My Brothers
description: Shawne Alstons family did not have much money when he was growing up in a rough part of Newport News, Va. He can remember some of his friends going to jail and some losing their lives to gang violence. Football was always Alstons escape.

title: Two Toasts From a Dusty Bottle
description: Dear Diary:

title: Amazons Living Lab: Reimagining Retail on Seattle Streets
description: SEATTLE  On a busy stretch of road in this citys Ballard neighborhood, a curious new grocery store is taking shape  and so begins another effort by Amazon to use the residents of its hometown as guinea pigs.

title: Sand Between Their Toes, and Blades on Their Feet
description: GEORGE TOWN, Cayman Islands  After trading long Canadian winters for the perpetual summer of this luxurious Caribbean tax haven, Bill Messer was content to enjoy the soft sands and warm waters of island living. The only thing he really missed was hockey.

title: When a Pillar of the Fourth Estate Rests on a Trump-Murdoch Axis
description: The ties that bind the most powerful media mogul in the world to the leader of the free world just keep getting stronger. Or, more precisely, we keep learning just how strong they are.

title: U.S. Soccer Looks to Premier League for a Performance Boost
description: U.S. Soccer is continuing a significant overhaul of its developmental program with the hiring of the top sports scientist in Englands Premier League, who will join the federation this month as its director of high performance.

title: Latrell Sprewell Visits. Minds Boggle. Knicks Win.
description: If the Knicks had hoped that Sunday afternoons game against the San Antonio Spurs would be a return to a semblance of normalcy, that notion did not last long.

title: Police Chiefs Say Trumps Law Enforcement Priorities Are Out of Step
description: Not surprisingly, President Trumps approach to crime, which began to take shape in a series of moves last week, generated swift criticism from liberals and civil rights groups.

title: As Japan Ages, Menus Adapt to Finding the Gourmet in Pures
description: YOKOHAMA, Japan  The 94-year-old man had come for lunch at a Chinese restaurant, and he was determined to make the most of his squid and leek stir-fry.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Since they just opened up the Second Avenue subway, maybe they could get some funding over here on the C train.

title: In the Face of Weighty Problems, Trump Focuses on Squabbles
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  The morning after North Korea launched a ballistic missile into the sea, apparently to test President Trumps resolve in his first days in office, the new commander in chief wanted to make one thing very clear to the world: Mark Cuban, the billionaire Dallas Mavericks owner, was not smart enough to have his job.

title: Anger and Mistrust Fuel Unabated Protests in Romania
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  Exactly one week after the largest protests in a quarter of a century rocked Romania, an estimated 70,000 demonstrators filled the square outside the main government building in Bucharest on Sunday evening, determined to show those in power that the crisis was far from over.

title: Trudeau and Trump Are to Meet, and Yellen Will Address Congress
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Immigration Agents Arrest 600 People Across U.S. in One Week
description: Federal immigration officials arrested more than 600 people across at least 11 states last week, detaining 40 people in the New York City area, law enforcement officials said on Sunday.

title: How the Election Shaped a Fashion Collection
description: The political events of 2016 pushed Joseph Altuzarra toward Renaissance painting and a protected feeling for his fall 2017 collection. And, he said, a move into the Woolworth Building was a move into adulthood.

title: Joseph Altuzarra Is Craving a Kind of Armor
description: In the latest installment of our series that goes inside the private working worlds of designers, Joseph Altuzarra reveals what was behind his latest collection, why he needs a door and why Tom Ford made him want to be a designer. And those are just the outtakes that didnt make it into the video. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Prabal Gurung: Fall 2017
description: Mr. Gurungs fall designs.

title: Slovene Ilka Stuhec Wins Womens Downhill Title at Alpine Ski World Championships
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland  Ilka Stuhec has proved she can carry the torch for Slovene Alpine skiing, winning a world downhill title and succeeding the recently retired Tina Maze, who accomplished the same for Slovenia two seasons ago.

title: Review: A Hairy Visionary Who Has the Rulers Ear
description: He was a drunk, a manipulator and a serial seducer. His influence may have hastened regime change. Apparently, he smelled of goats. But at least he didnt have a seat on the National Security Council, right?

title: Report Rebuts Russias Claims of Restraint in Syrian Bombing Campaign
description: WASHINGTON  Russian military officials have vociferously denied that their airstrikes have killed civilians in Syria, going so far as to say that eyewitness accounts that a major hospital was bombed last year in the brutal fight to retake Aleppo were mere fabrications.
