title: When (and How) to Enable Safari Reader View
description: Q.  Apples Safari browser used to have a Reader button on the right side of the address bar that made the webpage show just the text so you could read without videos, ads, animation and other stuff getting in the way. I recently got a new Mac and dont see this button anymore. Is it gone?

title: A Settlers View of Israels Future
description: HEBRON, West Bank  Last week, Israels Parliament passed a controversial bill that allows the government to retroactively authorize contested West Bank Jewish communities by compensating previous Palestinian land claimants. Opposition parties warn that this law could open Israel to prosecution at The Hague, and the chief Palestinian negotiator, Saeb Erekat, said, Israels Parliament has just approved a law to legalize theft of Palestinian land. This theme has been echoed recently at the Paris peace conference, in a United Nations Security Council resolution and by a major policy speech by then Secretary of State John Kerry, which all condemned settlements.

title: Daily Report: Tech Spreads Further Into Hospitality and Banking
description: The spread of technology continues to permeate many parts of our lives, including two areas that New York Times reporters looked at this week: hotels and A.T.M.s.

title: The Wedding Reporter
description: Vinny Mallozzi has covered 6,000 weddings for The New York Times.

title: Asian Marriages, Anthropologically Speaking
description: In the early years of The Timess wedding pages, marriages unusual enough to note were often between whites and Asian-Americans, most of which were rendered scandalous.

title: A Front-Page Proposal
description: Doug Shafner took a bold chance when he walked into The New York Times building in 1982 with the intention of buying a small front-page ad.

title: West Virginia (Loved by Handicappers) Falls to Kansas (Adored by Voters)
description: West Virginia led Kansas on Monday night by 14 points with three minutes to play. Ranked in the middle of the top 25 most of the season, the Mountaineers seemed ready to thrust themselves into the national championship picture.

title: A Photo Trend Worth Reviving?
description: The back seat of cars was a popular place to take post-wedding photos. That trend abruptly ended in 1960.

title: Flynn Is Exactly What Trump Deserves
description: Donald Trumps zeal for extreme vetting has one glaring exception, one gaping blind spot: his own administration.

title: Scalp-Cooling Caps Help Prevent Hair Loss in Chemo
description: Hair loss has long been considered an inevitable part of chemotherapy, and one of the most emotionally devastating aspects of cancer treatment. But advances in scalp-cooling technology, widely used in Europe to help chemotherapy patients keep their hair, may help the practice gain ground in the United States.

title: Human Gene Editing Receives Science Panels Support
description: An influential science advisory group formed by the National Academy of Sciences and the National Academy of Medicine on Tuesday lent its support to a once-unthinkable proposition: the modification of human embryos to create genetic traits that can be passed down to future generations.

title: Anicka Yi Is Inventing a New Kind of Conceptual Art
description: ONE AFTERNOON IN mid-December, the artist Anicka Yi traveled uptown to a Columbia University lab, where for the seventh time in as many weeks she had an appointment with a pair of biologists in preparation for an upcoming solo exhibition at the Guggenheim Museum.

title: Unbelievable Turmoil: Trumps First Month Leaves Washington Reeling
description: WASHINGTON  The resignation of Michael T. Flynn as national security adviser caps a remarkably tumultuous first month for President Trumps White House that has burdened the early days of his presidency with scandal, legal challenges, personnel drama and questions about his temperament during interactions with world leaders.

title: Can I Understand a Show Just by Watching Its Previously on Segments?
description: Are you trying to figure out what to watch next? Or maybe what TV show to give up on completely? Watching is here to help. Send a question to watching@nytimes.com and it may be answered in a future Ask Watching column. (Add shows to your Watchlist with a single click on any of the linked titles below.)

title: How to Keep Your Mothers Day Flowers Alive
description: If youve received a bouquet from that special someone this Mothers Day, or any other special occasion, you may be looking for ways to extend the gesture as long as possible.

title: Chris Rock Returns With Jokes and Personal Anguish
description: DURHAM, N.C.  As soon as Chris Rock strode onstage here on Monday in the first performance of his long-awaited Total Blackout Tour, he explained why, nine years after his last stand-up special, hes pacing stages again: Thats what alimony will do to you.

title: Russia Deploys Missile, Violating Treaty and Challenging Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Russia has secretly deployed a new cruise missile that American officials say violates a landmark arms control treaty, posing a major test for President Trump as his administration is facing a crisis over its ties to Moscow.

title: Donald Trump: Day 26
description: Were going to need a bigger hat.

title: Trumps Muted Tone on North Korea Gives Hope for Nuclear Talks
description: BEIJING  For 16 years, the United States has publicly refused to engage in direct talks with North Korea, arguing that doing so would reward it for bad behavior. In the meantime, the North raced ahead with its nuclear weapons program.

title: Tory Burch: Fall 2017
description: Ms. Burchs fall looks.

title: Chinese Tuxedo
description: Fusion done right at this revamped theater on Doyers Street in Chinatown in Manhattan.

title: Culinary Clashes End in Harmony at Chinese Tuxedo
description: The bend halfway down Doyers Street in Chinatown used to see more killings than any other stretch of road in the country. The Bloody Angle is safe now, but not quiet.

title: Saved From Holocaust: He Loved Me and He Wanted to Keep Me
description: On Valentines Day, couples often reminisce about that moment they knew they would stay together, whether during a vacation, over a fancy dinner or, perhaps, while meeting their future in-laws.

title: Democrats Demand Inquiry of Russian Role in U.S. Affairs; G.O.P. Concern Grows
description: WASHINGTON  The stunning resignation of Michael T. Flynn as White House national security adviser has emboldened congressional Democrats to demand a broader investigation into President Trumps ties to Russia  and compelled a small group of leading Republicans to acknowledge growing concerns over the episode.

title: What Is the Logan Act?
description: The resignation under pressure on Monday night of President Trumps national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn, centers on the F.B.I.s scrutiny of his phone calls in late 2016 with the Russian ambassador, Sergey I. Kislyak. The two apparently discussed sanctions the Obama administration was developing to punish Russia over allegations of interference in the 2016 presidential election; officials have asserted that Russia hacked Democratic emails and provided them to WikiLeaks for publication to help Mr. Trump.

title: Womens Fashion Shows: Oscar de la Renta, Monse, Proenza Schouler, Eckhaus Latta
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2017 collections that were presented in New York on Monday.

title: The Limits of Divestiture as an Antitrust Remedy
description: The Federal Trade Commissions recent study of its own merger remedies was in some ways an update of a well-regarded 1999 report on the divestitures almost always imposed when mergers are challenged.

title: Pedro Hernandez Found Guilty of Kidnapping and Killing Etan Patz in 1979
description: Pedro Hernandez, a former bodega stock clerk who confessed to luring 6-year-old Etan Patz into a basement and attacking him, was found guilty on Tuesday of murder and kidnapping, a long-awaited step toward closure in a case that bedeviled investigators for decades and changed forever the way parents watched over their children.

title: The Michael Flynn Resignation: What We Know, What We Dont
description: WASHINGTON  On Monday, Michael T. Flynn resigned as President Trumps national security adviser after admitting he had misled Vice President Mike Pence about his phone calls with a Russian diplomat. In his resignation letter, Mr. Flynn sincerely apologized to Mr. Pence and Mr. Trump, blaming the fast pace of events for what he called his incomplete account. Mr. Flynn has a well-established history with Russia, but there is still much about the case that is not clear.

title: Russia Reacts to Flynn Resignation
description: Leonid Slutsky, the Foreign Relations Committee chairman in the Russian State Duma, said Tuesday that he sees the accusations surrounding Michael T. Flynns resignation as an attack on Russia and that relations with the United States continue to be on thin ice.

title: Does Fame Have a Recipe? Dominique Crenns Fast Rise
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Five years ago, Dominique Crenn was just another hardworking Bay Area chef running a small, ambitious restaurant. She had been cooking since the early 1990s, when she arrived in this city from her native France, but she was still off the radar for many American food lovers. She had never won a James Beard award or served as a judge on Top Chef or hit any of the other marks of culinary stardom.

title: How Mar-a-Lago Turned Into the Situation Room
description: President Trump was shown responding to a national security crisis during dinner on Saturday night at Mar-a-Lago, his resort in Palm Beach Fla., as members and guests looked on.

title: A Day With Thom Browne's Dog
description: Meet the designer's miniature wire-haired dachshund  and muse.

title: In Eastern Mosul, Liberated From ISIS, Battle Rages Day and Night
description: New York Times journalists are in the city of Mosul to report on the battle there against the Islamic State.

title: NBC News Revamps Leadership and Acquires Stake in European Network
description: Two years ago, Andrew Lack came back to NBC News with a mandate to stabilize a division reeling from falling ratings and the Brian Williams crisis.

title: Trump Was Told Weeks Ago That Michael Flynn Withheld Truth on Russia
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump was informed more than two weeks ago that his national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn, had not told the truth about his interactions with Russias ambassador, and the president eventually asked for Mr. Flynns resignation after concluding he could not be trusted, a White House official said on Tuesday.

title: Michael Flynn, Tamil Nadu, Kim Jong-un: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Big Apple Circus, Sold to the Highest Bidder, Will Return This Fall
description: The Big Apple Circus, which shut down and filed for bankruptcy last year, is coming back  and just in time for its 40th anniversary.

title: Flames Fuel the Flavor in a Blood Orange Dessert
description: As often happens, the choice of dessert came down to a matter of gender politics. We were two couples dining last week at Augustine, Keith McNallys new Art Nouveau-style brasserie in the Beekman Hotel near City Hall.

title: Our Readers Favorite Romantic Movies
description: I dont know if its the mood of the times or just the mood of Times readers, but based on a highly unscientific (and endlessly fascinating) survey that started last week, the best movie romances (so far) of the 21st century serve the bitter with the sweet, the melancholy with the moonstruck.

title: Movies to Stream on Valentines Day, Whatever Your Mood
description: Watching is a film and TV recommendation site from The New York Times. Spot any titles you like while reading? With a single click on the links below, you can see where to stream a title while adding it to your Watchlist for later reference.

title: For Spring, the New Spirit of Sport
description: A somewhat poetic stance on the tension of design, encapsulated by layered, precision-cut separates.

title: London Mayor to Screen Iranian Film in Trafalgar Square on Oscar Night
description: The mayor of London said on Tuesday that he will stage an outdoor screening this month of the Oscar-nominated film The Salesman by an Iranian director who has refused to attend the Academy Awards ceremony to protest President Trumps executive order travel ban.

title: 13 Great Stories That Have Nothing to Do With Politics
description: Welcome to Our Picks, a guide to the best stuff to read, watch and listen to from around the internet. We know you dont want to read only political news, so were collecting great long-form articles, podcasts, videos and other web treasures you might like when you need a break. And yes, were also tooting our own horn here. Well share cant-miss Times stories from the week and surface some gems you might have overlooked.

title: Dont Look Now, but the Great Unbundling Has Spun Into Reverse
description: The internet promised to be the great unbundler. The evisceration of distribution costs would free consumers from paying for cable television channels they never watched, allowing them to bypass cable monopolies and pay only for the shows they wanted. No longer would anyone have to buy a $99-a-month triple-play package when all they wanted was the History Channel.

title: Five Hair Products for a Lived-in Look
description: Easy-to-use sprays and tools that promote truly effortless locks.

title: On TV, Does Bad Hair Signal a Better Show?
description: I judge television shows by the womens hair. It turns out this is a binary judgment: Either the women have TV hair, or they dont. What is TV hair? Its shiny, long, has obviously been styled with a curling iron at the ends, and looks like that of a beauty pageant contestant. (The style is known as The Cosmo in the parlance of Drybar, the blowout salon that has more than 70 locations across America.)

title: From Childrens Books to Live Theater: Mo Willems and Oliver Jeffers Have New Tales to Tell
description: Mo Willems and Oliver Jeffers  two of the most beloved, and singular, creators of childrens picture books working today  have both seen their literary creations head to the stage. The musical Elephant & Piggies We Are in a Play!, based on Willemss Elephant & Piggie series, recently finished a run at the New Victory Theater in New York and is setting out on a national tour; The Way Back Home, a puppet production based on Jefferss book of the same title, will be at the New Victory from March 10 through March 26. The two authors talked to Maria Russo, The Timess childrens books editor, about the thrills and embarrassments of childrens theater and their books very different journeys to the stage. These are edited excerpts from the conversation.

title: Ancient Jars Hold Clues About Earths Fluctuating Magnetic Fields
description: The Earths magnetic field  which deflects harmful space radiation from the surface  has been weakening, losing about 10 percent of its strength over the last two centuries, and the decay may have been accelerating in recent years.

title: Flynns Downfall Sprang From Eroding Level of Trust
description: WASHINGTON  Just days into his new position as President Trumps national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn found himself in a meeting that any White House official would dread. Face to face with F.B.I. agents, he was grilled about a phone call he had had with Russias ambassador.

title: An Eminent Psychiatrist Demurs on Trumps Mental State
description: To the Editor:

title: Opel-Peugeot Merger Faces a Winding Road
description: Carlos Tavares has shown he can quickly turn around troubled European carmakers. Within three years of his taking charge at the Paris-based PSA Group, the companys profit margin has tripled. Now Mr. Tavares may be preparing to take on a new challenge by acquiring General Motors troubled European unit.

title: What Are Your Rights if Border Agents Want to Search Your Phone?
description: Haisam Elsharkawi was about to travel from Los Angeles to Saudi Arabia last week when, he says, he was stopped at the airport, questioned, handcuffed, questioned some more and then released without charges three hours after his flight had departed.

title: Theater, for the 1 Percent
description: To the Editor:

title: Madre Mezcaleria, Featuring Mezcals, Opens in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn
description: MADRE MEZCALERIA The spotlight is back on Denisse Lina Chavez, the chef and a partner at El Atoradero, who withdrew from the kitchen in the fall after an injury. She is recovering, and shes back. And not only is she cooking her home-style Mexican fare at the restaurant, where she will be adding some new tacos and other dishes, but she is also making food for Madre Mezcaleria, a new bar next door specializing in mezcals, which she opened with her partner, Noah Arenstein. Light food like oysters, ceviches and tostadas are central to the bars menu. The space, with a dozen seats at the bar and a banquette with tables, includes talavera tiles that Ms. Chavez brought back from Mexico: 706 Washington Avenue (Prospect Place), Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, 718-399-0706.

title: Stephen Bannon and the Vatican
description: To the Editor:

title: 4 Indian Soldiers Are Killed in Raids on Militants in Jammu and Kashmir
description: NEW DELHI  Four Indian soldiers and four militants were killed in separate gun battles on Tuesday after security forces raided two villages in Indian-administered Kashmir, officials said.

title: Somewhere, Under There, Is a Dog
description: The Westminster Dog Show is much more than the show most experience on TV, a seemingly endless parade of immaculately groomed dogs on short leashes running in long loops. Spending a day backstage, an artist with a sketchbook pulls back the curtain on the pooches, the people and the primping.

title: Ethics Watchdog Denounces Conways Endorsement of Ivanka Trump Products
description: WASHINGTON  The White House adviser Kellyanne Conways public endorsement of Ivanka Trumps product line appears to be a clear violation of the prohibition against misuse of position, and she should be disciplined, the federal governments chief ethics watchdog wrote this week in a letter to the White House.

title: Roti, Trinidads Most Famous Culinary Export
description: In the West Indies, an Indian flatbread is the centerpiece of a grab-and-go lunch.

title: Roti, a Recipe Mastered Through Repetition
description: SAN FERNANDO, Trinidad and Tobago  It is, at a glance, simple and unremarkable: a circle of flatbread as flaccid as a cotton cloth, with a texture not quite as doughy as pita bread, yet fluffier than a tortilla.

title: Dubai Plans a Taxi That Skips the Driver, and the Roads
description: Like a scene from The Jetsons, commuters in Dubai, in the United Arab Emirates, may soon climb aboard automated flying taxis, soaring over busy streets and past the desert citys gleaming skyscrapers, all  quite literally  at the push of a button.

title: Alone
description: What would it mean to marry someone behind bars?

title: Alone
description: Note: This documentary short film won the Short Film Jury Award in non-fiction at the 2017 Sundance Film Festival.

title: What Californias Dam Crisis Says About the Changing Climate
description: STANFORD, Calif.  After five years of record-setting drought, much of California is being pummeled by an extremely wet winter. The disaster unfolding at Oroville, where precipitation is more than double the average, is the latest reminder that the United States needs a climate-smart upgrade of our water management systems.

title: Tears or Laughter? For This Plays Poster, Its Your Call
description: Meilan Mizell had a baby about two weeks before she was asked to be the model for artwork promoting Baby Screams Miracle, Clare Barrons dark drama about a family praying its way through a cataclysmic storm, now at the Woolly Mammoth Theater in Washington. In the image, shot by the photographer Cade Martin in collaboration with Jamin Hoyle, a freelance art director, Ms. Mizell portrays a water-drenched and windblown woman screaming (or is she laughing?) as she gazes at a lit candle in her hands.

title: Wait, What Is Netflixs Michael Bolton Valentines Day Special?
description: Michael Boltons Big, Sexy Valentines Day Special is Netflixs new, wildly silly and strange comedy one-off. It hails from Scott Aukerman (Comedy Bang Bang) and Akiva Schaffer (The Lonely Island), and includes appearances from Brooke Shields, Louie Anderson, Sarah Silverman, Sinbad, Michael Sheen, Eric Andre, Randall Park, Maya Rudolph and a dozen more comedians youll recognize if you watch a lot of contemporary comedy.

title: Gabriela Hearst: Fall 2017
description: Ms. Hearsts latest collection.

title: What Trump Is Doing Is Not O.K.
description: Thank God for the resignation in shame by Mike Flynn, President Trumps national security adviser. And not just because he misled the vice president and engaged in deeply malignant behavior with Russia, but, more important, because maybe it will finally get the United States government, Congress and the news media to demand a proper answer to what is still the biggest national security question staring us in the face today: What is going on between Donald Trump and the Russians?

title: The Security Breach at Mar-a-Lago
description: To the Editor:

title: Homesick for Another World, Food (and Bodily Functions) for Thought
description: There are a lot of bad teeth in Homesick for Another World, Ottessa Moshfeghs first book of stories. Some are yellow and nubbly, others jagged or clawlike. Sometimes these teeth protrude from black gums. The halitosis situation is code red. One woman reports, with less rancor than you might expect, that her lovers kisses taste like excrement.

title: Michael Flynn: A Timeline of His Tenure
description: The events that led to Flynns resignation as national security adviser in February 2017 stretch back to before President Trumps inauguration.

title: The Reporter, the Model, and the First Lady
description: A New York Times feature writer, Jacob Bernstein, has come forward as the reporter who made derogatory comments about Melania Trump at a Fashion Week event on Sunday, apologizing in a four-part tweet.

title: 19-Year-Old Runs for City Council in Georgia
description: When she was just 4 years old, Mary-Patricia Hector saw her friend having trouble remembering her lines during a preschool ceremony. So Mary-Pat, as she is called, bounded onstage, held her friends hand and recited the words until her friend found her voice.

title: Trendspotting: Arm Warmers at New York Fashion Week
description: Cozy accessories appeared on many of the fall 2017 runways.

title: Barbara Carroll, Pioneering Jazz Pianist and Singer, Dies at 92
description: Barbara Carroll, the jazz pianist and singer who for seven decades was a beloved fixture of Manhattan night life, died on Sunday in Manhattan. She was 92.

title: Secret Service Director to Retire, Allowing Trump to Pick Successor
description: The Secret Service director, who was hired two years ago to restore discipline and morale after a series of scandals and lapses at the agency that protects the president, said on Tuesday that he would retire next month, giving President Trump the chance to install his own choice.

title: The Statement Sleeve Gets Twisted
description: Fashions fixation on statement sleeves dates back a couple of seasons to the moment when designers began trotting out operatic versions, with most of the action focused up top.

title: The Resignation of Michael Flynn
description: To the Editor:

title: Oroville Is a Warning for California Dams, as Climate Change Adds Stress
description: LOS ANGELES  The St. Francis Dam was a proud symbol of Californias engineering might and elaborate water system  until just before midnight on March 12, 1928, when it collapsed, killing more than 400 people in a devastating wall of water. Ever since, the state has had a reputation of diligent inspections as it has built the largest network of major public dams in the nation.

title: Simone Rocha, on the Hunt for Photo Books
description: The designer pounded the pavement in New York to add to her collection of books  and find inspiration.

title: Shopping for Photography Books With Simone Rocha
description: On a freezing afternoon smack in the middle of New York Fashion Week, the Irish designer Simone Rocha is roaming SoHo and Chelsea on the hunt for vintage photo books. Her schedule this week is especially busy: She is giving a party to celebrate the opening of her first U.S. store before returning to London to reunite with her partner, Eoin McLoughlin, and her 1-year-old daughter, Valentine, and to put the finishing touches on her fall/winter 2017 collection, which will be presented during London Fashion Week on Saturday. Still, she has set aside time to scour town for new inspiration.

title: 9 Artists Honor the Man Who Put Brooklyn on the Map
description: When he announced his retirement as the president and executive producer of the Brooklyn Academy of Music in 1998, I argued in The Times that Harvey Lichtenstein had been the most innovative, influential performing arts administrator in New York history. With all due respect to Joseph Papp, I stand by that contention.

title: Off the Runway: Day 6 of New York Fashion Week
description: Scenes from Alice & Olivia, Badgley Mischka and Tory Burch.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Tug McGraws 73 Mets Rallying Cry? Its Now on a Phillies Wall
description: Fans of the Mets and the Phillies rarely agree on much, but one man has always brought them together: Tug McGraw, the plucky reliever who helped each franchise win its first championship. With spring training underway, McGraws famous rallying cry  Ya Gotta Believe  has sparked a playful feud between the teams.

title: Merce Cunningham and the Drama of Sheer Motion
description: MINNEAPOLIS  No choreographer in history has so naturally prompted museum exhibitions as Merce Cunningham. For more than 65 years, his form of radical dance theater was a vehicle for historic artistic experimentation, with brave breakthroughs of color, idiom, content. Musicians and visual artists were stimulated by the new directions that dance was taking.

title: How to Navigate a Museum
description: Whether its the Louvre in Paris, the Prado Museum in Madrid or the Egyptian Museum in Cairo, museums are major tourist destinations. There are ways to get the most out a museum visit, according to Natasha Schlesinger, an art historian, curator and the founder of ArtMuse, a company that provides private tours of museums and galleries in New York City and Europe. You want to do the museum justice and have fun at the same time, she said.

title: Welcome Guests
description: At this years Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show, cats shared a space with dogs.

title: What Cats Think of the Dog Show
description: Some would say that the true stars of this years Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show, which arrived in New York this week, are the cats. Featured as part of a collaboration with the International Cat Association, the cats drew consternation from some dog handlers, who felt the parvenus did not belong. The cats, being cats, did not care. They dressed up or dressed down, leapt through the occasional hoop and gazed witheringly on the efforts of their human and canine compatriots. Oh, to be a cat and be above it all.

title: Moncler Grenoble: Fall 2017
description: The latest collection from the label.

title: Katherine Heigl Tackles Tricky Cases and Jumbled Scripts in Doubt
description: Its great to see some of the stars of Doubt back on television, but did their return have to be in such a mess of a show? The series, a courtroom drama that begins Wednesday on CBS, seems to have been assembled by a particularly indifferent Victor Frankenstein, the parts crammed together without much regard for whether the stitching is visible or whether the finished product works.

title: The New York Times Celebrates 75 Years of Crosswords
description: Once considered a print-only, uber-intellectual pursuit, the puzzle has evolved to provide a satisfying diversion that anyone can learn and solve.

title: Purple Magazine, Philipp Plein and Opening Ceremony Founder Party on Monday Night of Fashion Week
description: Three parties were held on Monday, hosted by Olivier Zahm at Narcissa, Philipp Plein at the New York Public Library and Humberto Leon at Mission Chinese.

title: Purple Magazine, Philipp Plein and Opening Ceremony Founder Party on Monday Night of Fashion Week
description: A trio of parties on Monday night demonstrated how diverse the fashion week social scene can be. First, Purple magazine held its customary dinner at the Standard, East Village, a familial gathering of veteran scenesters overseen by Olivier Zahm, the magazines editor and nightlife consigliere. Then Philipp Plein hosted an extravagant affair at the New York Public Library, with a V.I.P. dinner upstairs and a bigger party downstairs. And Humberto Leon of Opening Ceremony teamed with photographer Ryan McGinley for a one-night revival of B.East, a popular gay party, at its former location on East Broadway.

title: How to Play Up This Seasons Best Hair Texture: Your Own
description: In recent seasons, many designers have made a strong appeal for women to feel comfortable in their own skin  starting with their hair. As a trend, it seems like lots of designers are embracing all the different kinds of girls they book by enhancing their natural beauty. So thats what weve done at Coach, noted Guido Palau, Redkens global creative director and the lead stylist responsible for creating the individually textured hair looks on the diverse cast of models at todays Coach show. Unlike the toughened-up, greasy-slick locks created to match last springs rock n roll-themed collection, Palau explained that the current style spoke more to the spirit of the fall/winter 2017 collection than its actual aesthetic: cool, easy and eclectic, he said.

title: Off the Runway: Day 6 of New York Fashion Week
description: Our photographers caught the action backstage and between the shows on day six of New York Fashion Week.

title: Were There Any Real Winners at the Grammys?
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: Crossword-Solving: A Search for Connections and Answers
description: After the bombing of Pearl Harbor, a New York Times editor made a decision: We ought to proceed with the puzzle.

title: Ex-Admiral and Member of Navy SEALs Is Top Choice to Replace Flynn
description: WASHINGTON  Robert S. Harward, the retired vice admiral who is President Trumps top choice to replace his ousted national security adviser, is a hard-charging member of the Navy SEALs who rose through the ranks to top military positions and is close with Jim Mattis, the new secretary of defense.

title: 11 Remarkable Crosswords for New Solvers
description: Ready to conquer The New York Times Crossword? Here's a sampling  hand-picked by Will Shortz  to get you started.

title: Producing the Oscars, and Finding Redemption
description: LOS ANGELES  As a brash, young executive at New Line Cinema in the 1990s, Michael De Luca championed risky films like the porn industry drama Boogie Nights and the serial-killer thriller Seven, putting fledgling filmmakers like Paul Thomas Anderson and David Fincher on the cultural map.

title: Coolness Factor Draws Developers to East Austin, Tex.
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  About five years ago, a young bartender in downtown Austin told Josh Delk that she was renting a house on the other side of nearby Interstate 35, in the lower part of a rambling East Austin neighborhood that stretches from the Colorado River north to 12th Street.

title: Michael Flynn, Kim Jong-un: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: For Some Labels, Its All About the Show
description: On the second floor of the Ukrainian National Home on Second Avenue, a toque-clad chef in a billowing, teardrop-shaped wedding gown came down the Vaquera runway; a woman wore a Vaquera version of an oversize Tiffany & Company jewelry bag. It was a drizzly Sunday afternoon, but the line at the door had been long. Vaquera, a four-year-old collective, promises a show and what it promises it delivers.

title: 75 Years of Crosswords
description: After the bombing of Pearl Harbor, a New York Times editor made the decision to run a crossword puzzle in the paper to offer relief to its war-weary readers. Seventy-five years later, The New York Times Crossword continues to be a source of comfort for readers. Here's how it got there.

title: SoftBank of Japan Will Buy U.S. Private Equity Giant Fortress
description: Over its three-decade existence, the Japanese conglomerate SoftBank and its founder, Masayoshi Son, have been known for ambitious and sometimes head-scratching moves.

description: Stuart Vevers shows his fall looks for the label.

description: In the hours since Michael T. Flynn resigned as national security adviser late Monday, two narratives have emerged.

description: $5.57 MILLION

title: Timeline: What We Now Know About Flynns Phone Calls With Russia
description: What happened behind the scenes and what was known and said publicly.

title: Oroville Crews Lower Reservoir, Easing Threat Posed by New Storms
description: Engineers in Oroville, Calif., began to slow the draining of a reservoir that had prompted a major flooding scare last weekend, saying that they had lowered the water level enough to make room for a new round of wet weather.

title: What Beyonc Won Was Bigger Than a Grammy
description: Black people have great imaginations, not just in the arts but in everyday life. We imagined ourselves as family when we were treated as property. We imagine equity and freedom when we seldom get to experience them. We imagine a generous and loving God when it often seems that if there is a God, he does not love black folks nearly as much as we love him on Sunday mornings.

title: Westminster Dog Show 2017: Rumor the German Shepherd Wins Best in Show
description: As Rumor, a German shepherd, took long, elegant strides around the ring at the 141st Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show, she seemed to cover every inch of the green carpet.

title: Stanley Bard, Who Ran Chelsea Hotel as a Bohemian Sanctuary, Dies at 82
description: Stanley Bard, a Robin Hood of innkeepers who nurtured talented writers and artists and tolerated assorted deadbeats as the manager and part-owner of the Chelsea Hotel in Manhattan for more than 40 years, died on Tuesday in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 82.

title: Modi Faces Disappointed Voters in Indias Most Populous State
description: KIWANA, India  Villagers in the cane-growing region in Uttar Pradesh, Indias most populous state, helped sweep Prime Minister Narendra Modi to power nearly three years ago.

title: Greg Kurstin, Adeles No. 2, on the Grammys, Beyonc and Getting Cut Off
description: Greg Kurstin, the in-demand pop producer and songwriter, was the guy standing next to Adele on Sunday when she cleaned up at the Grammy Awards, sweeping all five categories in which she was nominated, including song, record and album of the year.

title: If trends spawn hashtags, call this beauty movement the #WomensSpring
description: New York Fashion Week has a message: Theres a new power woman in town, and shes not afraid to manhandle beauty stereotypes to her liking.

description: If trends spawn hashtags, call this beauty movement the #WomensSpring.

title: American Girls New Doll: Its a Boy!
description: American Girls newest doll is  a boy?

title: Coach Jeff Hornacek Expects Knicks to Remain Intact at Trade Deadline
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Nine days before the N.B.A. trade deadline, the Knicks assembled at their training site on Tuesday to practice and to build on their unexpected win over the San Antonio Spurs on Sunday. It was, for them, a high note to sing after weeks of tumult.

title: Venezuela Closes Ranks Around Sanctioned Vice President, Tareck El Aissami
description: LIMA, Peru  President Nicols Maduro of Venezuela on Tuesday defended his second-in-command, who has been sanctioned by the United States over allegations that he is a narcotics trafficker, and said he would demand a public apology from the American government.

title: A Venture Capitalists Misguided Critique of a Trump Adviser
description: When a man worth more than $3 billion attacks another billionaire as greedy and as a character out of Goodfellas, you know something unusual is happening. In this case, it may be a sign that all is not well in the world of private funds.

title: Whod Want to Limit Retirement Plans? House Republicans
description: There is no overstating how unprepared Americans are to retire. Nearly half of private-sector employees  some 55 million people  do not have an employer-provided retirement plan. Most of them are low- to middle-income earners who will end up relying on Social Security for between half and all of their income in retirement.

title: Sounders Clint Dempsey Is Cleared to Return From Heart Problem
description: TUKWILA, Wash.  In the aftermath of learning in August that he had an irregular heartbeat, Clint Dempsey relayed a straightforward desire to Seattle Sounders Coach Brian Schmetzer: He wanted to go out on his feet.

title: Westminster Dog Show Photos: A Final Flurry
description: Handlers and their dogs prepared for their shot at Best in Show at the Westminster Dog Show at Madison Square Garden on Tuesday.

title: Knicks James Dolan Offers Apology; Charles Oakley Says He Wont Accept It
description: Charles Oakley sounds as if he is not quite ready to move on.

title: Confusion at the Postal Counter
description: Dear Diary:

title: Humana Plans to Pull Out of Obamacares Insurance Exchanges
description: Humana announced on Tuesday that it would no longer offer health insurance coverage in the state marketplaces created under the federal health care law, becoming the first major insurer to cast a no-confidence vote over selling individual plans on the public exchanges for 2018.

title: Bill de Blasio Shifts Focus to Good-Paying Jobs in Election Year
description: David N. Dinkins sat in the front row of the Apollo Theater, his hands folded atop his cane, awaiting a State of the City address Monday night from his protg-turned-mayor, Bill de Blasio, that would tackle the thorniest issues before New York.

title: Fashion Week Briefing: Tiffany Trump and an All-Immigrant Casting
description: Happy Valentines Day.

title: Yankees Are Rebuilding Everywhere as Spring Training Starts
description: TAMPA, Fla.  As pitchers and catchers reported to George M. Steinbrenner Field on Tuesday morning for their first official day of spring training, they were greeted by an unusual sight: a parade of hydraulic lifts, buzzing power tools and workers in hard hats hustling to finish a $40 million improvement project in time for the preseason opener 10 days away.

title: Immigrant Protected Under Obama Program Now Fights His Arrest
description: LOS ANGELES  More than two years ago, Daniel Ramirez Medina, an unauthorized immigrant, applied for a special program created under the Obama administration that would allow him to stay and work in the United States.

title: Democrats Set Sights on Blocking Trumps Labor Secretary Pick
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats failed to block an education secretary who had no experience in public schools. They have gotten little traction against a nominee to lead the Energy Department who once called for the agencys abolition, or a potential head of the Environmental Protection Agency who has made a career out of suing it.

title: He Sent de Blasio 2 Dozen Letters. He Got Zero Replies.
description: As soon as Bill de Blasio was elected mayor, Wallace Cheatham figured that a cause he had long championed  the creation of a permanent, prominent honor for the citys first black police commissioner  would be quickly approved.

title: A Victory for Trump Is a Victory for Big-Name Traders
description: Carl C. Icahn is one of several billionaire investors who have bet big on a Donald J. Trump presidency.

title: Second Etan Patz Jury Provides Closure to the First
description: When a guilty verdict was read on Tuesday at the second trial in the Etan Patz murder case, two jurors from the first trial, which ended in a bitterly hung jury, were sitting in the gallery, holding hands with Etans father, Stanley Patz.

title: Indians, No Longer Underdogs, Seek Another Title Shot
description: GOODYEAR, Ariz.  It is a long climb up to the summit, to Game 7 of the World Series, at home in extra innings. That is where the Cleveland Indians found themselves in November, the apex of an especially jagged path. The Chicago Cubs knocked them down, stole their flag and planted it in baseball lore. The loss still hurts, and it always will.

title: Jeff Sessions Resists Pressure to Remove Himself in Russia Inquiries
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Jeff Sessions faced growing pressure on Tuesday to remove himself from any role in investigating President Trumps aides and their relationship with Russia, but advisers to Mr. Sessions said he saw no need to do so.

title: White House Upheaval Complicates Netanyahu Visit
description: WASHINGTON  When Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel meets with President Trump on Wednesday, in their first face-to-face encounter since Mr. Trumps inauguration, the turmoil in the White House could complicate what many had expected would be a triumphant reception.

title: The Missing Pieces in the Flynn Story
description: President Trump may have thought the departure of his national security adviser, Michael Flynn, would end the controversy over his administrations involvement with Russia, but the damning revelations keep coming. The whole fiasco underscores the dysfunction and dishonesty of his White House and how ill prepared it is to protect the nation.

title: Cuomo Blocks New York City Plastic Bag Law
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed a bill on Tuesday effectively killing a law that would have imposed a 5-cent fee on plastic bags in New York City, disappointing environmentalists as well as city leaders who characterized the move as a classic case of Albanys overreach.

title: Nadals Will Shake Up a Unique Tennis Relationship
description: There has been no one else in modern tennis quite like the Nadals: an all-in-the family, often-all-conquering duo composed of Toni Nadal and his nephew Rafael, who remains Rafael  not Rafa  to Toni.

title: Brandon Maxwell: Fall 2017
description: Mr. Maxwell, known for his work with Lady Gaga, shows his latest looks.

title: Friend of San Bernardino Attacker Will Plead Guilty to Supplying Guns
description: A longtime friend of one of the attackers in the 2015 mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif., has agreed to plead guilty to plotting two unrealized terrorist attacks in the state in 2011 and 2012 and to buying the weapons used in the massacre, federal officials said on Tuesday.

title: Trump Campaign Aides Had Repeated Contacts With Russian Intelligence
description: WASHINGTON  Phone records and intercepted calls show that members of Donald J. Trumps 2016 presidential campaign and other Trump associates had repeated contacts with senior Russian intelligence officials in the year before the election, according to four current and former American officials.

title: From Thomas Wolfe to Sid Vicious, Artists and the Chelsea Hotel
description: Since it opened in 1884, the Chelsea Hotel, the landmark Bohemian retreat in Manhattan, has welcomed many famous long-term residents, among them writers, musicians and artists, calling itself a rest stop for rare individuals.

title: Why Michael Flynn Resigned
description: In February, Michael T. Flynn stepped down as national security adviser amid a scandal surrounding his contacts with Russia before President Trump took office.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: When you build a dam, you are playing God. And its tough to be God.

title: Max Ferr, a Trailblazer for Latino Theater, Dies at 79
description: Max Ferr, a founder and the first artistic director of the Intar Hispanic American Arts Center, an innovative Off Broadway theater company that nurtures and produces the works of Latino playwrights in English, died on Feb. 4 in Miami. He was 79.

title: Liberal Activists Join Forces Against a Common Foe: Trump
description: For years, Justin Boyan worried about the effects of climate change but focused on his wife, his two daughters and his work as a computer scientist in Rhode Island. Then Donald J. Trump became president, and Mr. Boyan was jolted into political activism.

title: Resist Is a Battle Cry, but What Does It Mean?
description: Resist has become a one-word battle cry for the anti-Trump forces. But what does it mean?

title: Like a Kid in a Candy Store
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Today is the 75th anniversary of the first crossword puzzle to run in The New York Times and, by all accounts, shes looking pretty SPRY.

title: Narciso Rodriguez: Fall 2017
description: Mr. Rodriguez shows his fall collection.

title: Mets David Wright Exercising Caution About Returning to Throwing
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, FLA.  David Wright arrived here for spring training several weeks ago. Since then, Mets Manager Terry Collins has reminded Wright frequently that the door to his office is open, and that the communication between them needs to be daily and detailed.

title: Intel Drops Its Sponsorship of Science Fairs, Prompting an Identity Crisis
description: The science fair has been an annual rite of education for generations of students, going back to the 1940s. But even the term science fair stirs stereotypical images of three-panel display boards and baking-soda volcanoes. Its regimented routines can seem stodgy at a time when young people are flocking to more freewheeling forums for scientific creativity, like software hackathons and hardware engineering Maker Faires.

title: F.A.A. Investigates Errant Flight Involving Harrison Ford
description: Harrison Ford, the actor known for his portrayal of a cocky smuggler and spacecraft pilot in the Star Wars movies, mistakenly flew a private plane over a commercial airliner carrying more than 100 people at a California airport on Monday, according to a news report.

title: Corrections: February 15, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Rare Rat-Related Disease Kills a Bronx Victim, the City Says
description: New York City is investigating three recent cases  one of them fatal  of a rare disease transmitted through rat urine that have occurred in the Grand Concourse neighborhood of the Bronx, according to the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.

title: Russia, Kim Jong-un, PewDiePie: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: In Taipei, Restaurants That Harness the Bounty of Taiwan
description: Taipei has always been a city where one doesnt have to work hard to eat awfully well: It has a street food scene as vibrant as that of Bangkok; restaurants that specialize in both Taiwanese and regional cuisines from around China; thousands of cheap and cheerful joints at which to drink cold beer with small plates and quick stir-fries; and a plethora of sushi bars, a remnant of decades spent under Japanese rule.

title: Bodies Bending Sound in the Guggenheim
description: The acclaimed choreographers Michelle Dorrance and Nicholas Van Young team up to create a new dance piece for the Guggenheim Museums rotunda. See the percussive dance from above and below.

title: Five Places to Shop in Stockholm
description: With its grand thoroughfares and stately 19th-century buildings, Stockholms Ostermalm neighborhood, in the eastern part of the city about a 10-minute walk from the city center, is elegant and refined. Its also an upscale residential area thats dotted with unique specialty stores, many of which have been around for several decades or more. Stockholmers come here when theyre on the hunt for an eye-catching item, be it an antique, a rare book or a piece of vintage furniture.

title: Michelle Dorrance Boomwhacks the Guggenheim Rotunda
description: It came as something of a shock, one night in January, when people high on the corkscrew ramp of the Guggenheim Museums spiral rotunda started beating on the balustrade with sticks.

title: Pyer Moss: Fall 2017
description: The label shows its fall designs.

title: An Israeli Desert City Blooms as a Soccer Power
description: BEERSHEBA, Israel  As night began to fall and Shabbat came to an end, the lights of Turner Stadium crackled to life and Beersheba awoke.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Katherine Heigl in Doubt and Peyton Manning on Modern Family
description: Katherine Heigl tries for another television comeback, this time as a legal eagle whose heart beats fast for a hunky client charged with murdering his girlfriend. Nature ventures into the wilderness with its adorable spy creatures. And Peyton Manning plays ball on Modern Family.

title: Fighting on Behalf of Chinas Women  From the United States
description: The day after President Trumps inauguration, hundreds of thousands of women took to the streets for the Womens March on Washington. Among them were Lu Pin and more than 20 other Chinese feminists who live in the United States and belong to the Chinese Feminism Collective, a new nongovernmental organization to support feminist activities that are facing sustained political pressure in China. Using a WeChat account, they sent reports from the Washington march back to China.

title: Runoff Likely in Jakarta Election Seen as Test of Tolerance for Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The Christian governor of the capital of Indonesia, the worlds most populous Muslim-majority nation, has been fighting for his political life in an election campaign charged with religious and ethnic undertones. After voters went to the polls Wednesday, it appeared that he would have to fight a little longer.

description: Don Winslow has seen photojournalism go from an envied profession to just another budget line to be cut, resulting in an economic and philosophical devaluation of the image.

title: Sanctuary Cities in Name Only
description: President Trumps plan to deport millions of people appears to be underway. Last week, federal immigration officials arrested more than 600 people at their homes and workplaces in at least 11 states, sending terror through immigrant communities.

description: Dear President Trump:

title: Winning Streak
The Trump Eras Catholic Mirror
description: There is a natural desire for a unifying theory of all the disturbances in Western institutions, a way to make all the conflicts into one so that an unstable situation can be distilled and understood. Which is why, over the last week, theres been an attempt to unite American politics and Vatican intrigue into a single melodrama, in which the same populist forces that elevated Donald Trump are supposedly trying to pull Pope Francis down.

title: Questions for: Sand Between Their Toes, and Blades on Their Feet
