description: To the Editor:

title: Cara Buckley: Gearing Up for the 2017 Academy Awards
description: On Wednesday, Feb. 22, Cara Buckley, a culture reporter at The Times, was on hand for a live chat in advance of the Oscars.

title: How to Fill Out Your Tax Return Like a Pro
description: Trimming your income taxes is an exercise in financial fitness. You are aiming for a low number. As in golf, thats a goal that can be achieved honorably with skill and practice.

title: Seeing Fashion Week from the First Row
description: It was the fifth day of New York Fashion Week, and Laura Brown, the new editor in chief of InStyle magazine, had to be at the Zimmermann show on West 46th Street in five minutes.

title: Limited to Prewar Music, Bulgarian Station Thrives
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  Because of a recent copyright dispute, Bulgarian National Radio, the public broadcaster for the country, has been limited to airing music recorded before 1946. And so far, their listeners seem to have no problem with it.

title: Street Style: Best of New York Fashion Week
description: The best street style looks of the week.

title: Afropunk: Feeling Black Activisms Joy, and Its Pain
description: As Black History Month commemorations start to wind down, one festival is just gearing up. Afropunk the Takeover  Harlem, running from Tuesday through Feb. 25, will celebrate black culture with music, art, film screenings, discussions and comedy.

title: Red Carpet Watch: Nicole Kidman
description: The actress, nominated for an Academy Award for her role in Lion, is known for making bold sartorial choices.

title: Trump Aides Try to Reassure Europe, but Many Are Wary
description: MUNICH  While President Trump has disrupted assumptions about American foreign policy, members of his cabinet have been scrambling to reassure allies that the United States remains a bedrock of support.

title: Nicole Kidmans Strategy: Never Play It Safe
description: Peruse any list of best red carpet dresses of all time, and youll certainly find Nicole Kidman on it. Her 1997 chartreuse gown by John Galliano for Christian Dior was a head-turner. With its Asian-inspired floral embroidery and fur-trimmed side slit, there was nothing like it at the Oscars. Two decades later, Ms. Kidman, 49, is just as gutsy.

title: New Question for a Frequent Champion: Whether to Meet the President
description: STORRS, Conn.  When Connecticut won its 11th N.C.A.A. womens basketball title last spring its fourth in a row  President Barack Obama joked that he would keep a room with a cot waiting for Coach Geno Auriemma and the Huskies regular visit to the White House.

title: Street Style: Best of New York Fashion Week
description: Fashion week is over in New York, but the street style lives on in photos. And theres much more to come from Europe.

title: Trump Rails Against Leaks. But What Exactly Are They?
description: If there were an award for news media buzzword of the week, this one could go to leak.

title: A Chord Vanishing Into Eternity: The 8 Best Classical Music Moments This Week
description: In addition to reviews, features and news published during the week, our critics and reporters collect the best of what theyve been hearing: the notes that sent shivers down their spines, the memorable voices, the set changes that left them breathless, the quotations that cut to the heart of the story.

title: Whistleblower Lawsuit Accuses Insurer
description: UnitedHealth Group bilked Medicare out of perhaps billions of dollars by making people look sicker than they were, a whistle-blower suit says.

title: The Top 10 Moments From New York Fashion Week
description: Who says fashion is just about the clothes? This week, several New York designers used their shows to send messages (some subtle  others much more overt) about the Trump administration and the political atmosphere in general. Public School showed red baseball caps that read "Make America New York," while the designer Adam Lippes made signs and displayed them outside his Washington Square Park home, where the Planned Parenthood march took place later that day. And at Prabal Gurung, the designer closed his show by sending models out in a series of T-shirts with message such as I Am an Immigrant and Revolution Has No Borders.

title: Winter at the Waldorf
description: Recent events included the Viennese Opera Ball, a gala for the Human Rights Campaign, and the Black & White Panda Ball

title: Winter at the Waldorf
description: The 62nd Viennese Opera Ball on Feb. 10 benefited a project about Leonard Bernstein at the Jewish Museum. The Human Rights Campaign, an advocacy group for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender issues, honored Meryl Streep and others at its New York gala on Feb. 11. And the Black & White Panda Ball, which seeks to bring two giant pandas to New York, held its first benefit on Feb. 8. The events took place at the Waldorf Astoria.

title: Trumps Approval Ratings Are Down. How Much Does It Mean?
description: Donald J. Trump won the presidential election as the least popular candidate in the polling era. He assumed the presidency with the lowest approval rating of any incoming president.

title: Stuart McLean, Who Created Radios The Vinyl Cafe, Dies at 68
description: Stuart McLean, a Canadian journalist who found fame on the radio as a gentle and optimistic humorist, died on Feb. 15 in Toronto. He was 68.

title: Eco-Friendly, Nontoxic and Vegan: Its a Condom
description: A dozen employees at Rickys, a beauty shop in downtown New York, huddled below a display of lustrous wigs. Around them, hair irons, press-on nails and makeup kits were stacked to the ceiling. But on this morning, the clerks had gathered to learn about an unusual new item on the shelves: nontoxic, eco-friendly vegan condoms.

title: Germanys Taboos, Once a Bulwark Against the Far Right, May Now Be Enabling It
description: POTSDAM, Germany  As the far right rises across Europe, its ascent in Germany has seemed among the most alarming and puzzling.

title: Trump Calls the News Media the Enemy of the American People
description: President Trump, in an extraordinary rebuke of the nations press organizations, wrote on Twitter on Friday that the nations news media is the enemy of the American people.

title: Scott Pruitt, Boeing, European Union: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Friends No More? Jorge Prez and Donald Trump
description: MIAMI  Who does Donald J. Trump call when he needs a wall built on the United States-Mexico border? An old friend, it turns out: the luxury-condo king of Miami, Jorge Prez  often described as the Donald Trump of the tropics.

title: Canada Today: Asylum Seekers, Conservative Choices and Your Thoughts
description: The image associated most commonly with refugees arriving in Canada is that of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and members of his cabinet greeting Syrians at Torontos airport late in 2015. But the global chaos created for many asylum seekers by President Donald J. Trumps executive order on immigration has brought attention to another and potentially more dangerous path to Canada. Catherine Porter, Dan Levin and I looked into the migrants who sometimes crawl through snow to reach Canada from the United States.

title: Work Stops at C.D.C.s Top Deadly Germ Lab Over Air Hose Safety
description: Work at the high-security government lab that handles deadly pathogens like the Ebola virus has been suspended since Feb. 16, when it was discovered that nylon hoses used to pump air into the scientists protective suits had not been designed or tested for breathing safety, officials said on Friday. The hoses have been in use since 2005.

title: Britain Seeks to Cancel Sale of R.B.S. Branch Network
description: LONDON  The British government said on Friday that it would ask the European Commission not to require Royal Bank of Scotland to sell its Williams & Glyn branch network by the end of this year.

title: 17 Great Books About American Presidents for Presidents Day Weekend
description: Theres nothing like a big juicy presidential biography when youre looking for guidance about historys long and hard lessons. Weve selected some of our favorites by and about presidents from the past few decades  and including one that reaches back into the 19th century. Heres to an inspiring Presidents Day weekend.

title: The Education of Brady Skjei
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Rangers defenseman Brady Skjei carries one souvenir from his rookie N.H.L. season: a two-inch scar on his chin, where he was inadvertently kicked by his teammate Kevin Hayes during a game in December. Skjei had never taken a skate in the face before.

title: Abba Tor, Who Engineered T.W.A. Terminal at Kennedy Airport, Dies at 93
description: Abba Tor, whose engineering prowess helped the landmark Trans World Flight Center take wing at Kennedy International Airport  and kept it from cracking apart  died on Feb. 11 in Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y. He was 93.

title: To Fund Health Plan, G.O.P. Considers Limiting Popular Tax Break
description: In order to fund health insurance for Americans who dont get coverage through work, congressional Republicans are considering changing the system for those who do.

title: The Fight Over Guantnamos Parole Board, Explained
description: WASHINGTON  In a letter to President Trump made public this week, 11 Republican senators said that a parole-like board that decides whether to recommend transferring Guantnamo Bay detainees should be suspended immediately.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Hes a good friend. Or at least he was, until I made a statement about the wall.

title: At Dellin Betances Arbitration Hearing, Yankees Cite Stolen Bases
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  When Dellin Betances stands on the pitchers mound, it is often with a stone face. One of the best relief pitchers in baseball, Betances may not be flawless, but he rarely appears cowed by a boisterous crowd, a difficult jam or a fearsome hitter.

title: A Push for Diesel Leaves London Gasping Amid Record Pollution
description: LONDON  Every winter, as if on cue, the coughing begins.

title: Labor Nominees Role in Sex Case Could Draw Scrutiny
description: For R. Alexander Acosta, President Trumps new pick for labor secretary, renewed attention on a salacious lawsuit may not come at a great time.

title: Paramount Pictures C.E.O. Is Said to Be Negotiating His Exit
description: LOS ANGELES  One of Hollywoods longest-serving studio chiefs, Brad Grey, is negotiating his departure from Paramount Pictures, which has struggled at the box office after a period of severe underinvestment by Viacom, its troubled corporate owner.

title: A Young Reporter Makes a Soft Query and Pleases an Upset President
description: During President Trumps strenuous and freewheeling news conference on Thursday, there emerged a brief respite from the pointed questions about Russia, national security, immigration policy and chaos at the White House.

title: Jason Day Wont Speed Up Play, Despite Fans Shrinking Attention Spans
description: LOS ANGELES  Nobody can accuse Jordan Spieth or Jason Day of dawdling on his ascent to golfs mountaintop. Spieth was 22 when he first reached the No. 1 ranking, and Day was 27. For long stretches last season, Day and Spieth took turns in the top two spots in the world rankings.

title: Five Key Moments From Snaps I.P.O. Roadshow Video
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Snap, the parent company of the ephemeral-message application Snapchat, on Friday revealed its own story: the video presentation it will use to pitch investors as it prepares to go public in a few weeks.

title: Criminal Acts Led to Arrests of Immigrants in New York Area, Officials Say
description: When federal immigration officials arrested 41 people in the New York region this month, immigrant advocates suggested the action was an indication of the Trump administrations new priorities in detaining and deporting undocumented immigrants.

title: In T. J. Leaf, U.C.L.A. Finds a Supersize Swiss Army Knife
description: LOS ANGELES  Brad Leaf had early exposure to European-style big men, those 7-footers who pass ably from the post and create shots from the perimeter.

title: Tom Brokaw: The Offer From Nixon I Refused
description: When Sean Spicer was appointed White House press secretary by President Trump, Mr. Spicer tweeted, Thank you @realDonaldTrump for this amazing honor.

title: Popular Domestic Programs Face Ax Under First Trump Budget
description: WASHINGTON  The White House budget office has drafted a hit list of programs that President Trump could eliminate to trim domestic spending, including longstanding conservative targets like the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, the Legal Services Corporation, AmeriCorps and the National Endowments for the Arts and the Humanities.

title: White Sox Prospect Michael Kopech Stands Out in Era of Hard Throwers
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Michael Kopech can throw a baseball at 105 miles per hour. Even in this age of turbocharged pitching, he gets your attention. One of Kopechs favorite players retired before he was born, but he set the standard for power pitchers from Texas.

title: Travis dArnauds Problem? Throwing With Too Much Arm
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  More than an hour before the bustle of spring training workouts began on Friday, Glenn Sherlock and his No. 1 pupil, Travis dArnaud, began yet another day in their reclamation project, alone on a practice field.

title: Corrections: February 18, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: How the North Korean Nuclear Threat Has Grown
description: When North Korea tested a missile that fell harmlessly into the sea this month, it was more than just an attempt by its 33-year-old leader, Kim Jong-un, to jolt a new American president. Arms experts observed something new: solid-fuel technology that makes such missiles easier to hide and launch quickly. North Koreas nuclear weapons program has progressed in four areas that bear watching: arsenal size, bomb strength, missile technology and ability to elude detection.

title: Saloua Raouda Choucair, Early Exponent of Abstract Arabian Art, Dies at 100
description: Saloua Raouda Choucair, a Lebanese artist and one of the first abstractionists in the Arab world, whose sense of line and form  derived from Islamic art  brought a new idiom to modernism, died on Jan. 26 at her home in Beirut. She was 100.

title: President Trump, White House Apprentice
description: Its with a whiff of desperation that President Trump insists these days that hes the chief executive Washington needs, the decisive dealmaker who, as he said during the campaign, alone can fix it. What America has seen so far is an inept White House led by a celebrity apprentice.

title: Not as Shy as One Might Think
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Have you grown weary of greeting new constructors? We have another debut this week, by Steve Overton and its a very interesting one: Its clean, its interesting and Mr. Overton has craftily sneaked his name into the crossword at 12D.

title: Sharing the NATO Burden
description: For many years now, successive American administrations have made no secret of their frustration with how little most NATO allies spend on their militaries, leaving the United States with a disproportionately large share of the bill for the joint defense. Jim Mattis, the new secretary of defense, recently expressed much the same frustration in remarks delivered in Brussels. Its a message the other 27 members of the alliance should pay careful attention to. But Mr. Mattis went further, warning that unless the allies paid up, America might reduce its commitment. This part of his speech  in which he echoed his boss, President Trump  sent the wrong message at the wrong time.

title: The Grunts War
description: By 1967, protesters were gathering regularly in Lafayette Park across the street from the White House. Theyd hold signs, give speeches and chant: Hey, hey, L.B.J. How many babies did you kill today?

title: Mr. Trump, Our 15th President Thanks You
description: Theres a bright side to everything. Its true that Donald Trump could turn out to be the worst American president ever. But think how happy thats going to make James Buchanan fans.

title: Fact Check: Trumps News Conference
description: President Trump spoke about his executive orders, the economy and his polls. We checked the facts.

title: George Steele, the Animal Wrestler and Mild-Mannered Teacher, Dies at 79
description: George Steele, a gruff, green-tongued fighter who, as the Animal, was one of wrestlings wildest and most-hated villains, has died, World Wrestling Entertainment, the professional wrestling organization, said on Friday. He was 79.

title: Congolese Soldiers Reportedly Fire on Unarmed Civilians
description: Footage shared by human rights activists appeared to show soldiers killing unarmed civilians in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Look, They Are Dying: Video Appears to Show Massacre by Congolese Soldiers
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The video opens with a squad of soldiers walking down a sandy, sunlit road toward a group of people who are chanting.

title: When Lies Overruled Rights
description: When President Trump signed an executive order temporarily banning travel from seven majority Muslim countries, he hurled us back to one of the darkest and most shameful chapters of American history. Executive orders that go after specific groups under the guise of protecting the American people are not only unconstitutional, but morally wrong. My father, and so many other Americans of Japanese descent, were targets of just such an order during World War II.

title: Michael Rainey, Boutique Owner in Swinging London, Dies at 76
description: Michael Rainey, who dressed the Beatles and the Rolling Stones in flamboyant, boldly colored designs from his avant-garde London mens boutique and briefly became part of the citys swinging fashion scene in the 1960s, died on Jan. 28 in Granada, Spain. He was 76.

title: Keeping the Kremlins Hands Off Frances Elections
description: With the United States engulfed in questions about Russias role in the 2016 presidential election, France is determined to head off any such meddling in its coming presidential election.

title: Brooklyn Boy, 5, Is Critically Wounded in Pit Bull Attack
description: A 5-year-old Brooklyn boy was viciously mauled at home on Friday evening by one of his familys two pit bulls, leaving him in critical condition, according to the police and a family member.

title: Good Conversation, and a Few Dissertations
description: Jasmine Monica Liverpool and Isaiah Henry Norman were married Feb. 18 at Flowerfield Celebrations, an event space in St. James, N.Y. Bishop Larry Carzelle Dudley Sr., who was ordained in the Church of God, officiated.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: The Legend of Tarzan and Planet Earth II
description: Alexander Skarsgard forgoes the loincloth  the better to show off his hard-won physique  in The Legend of Tarzan. And Planet Earth II, with David Attenborough, takes nature photography to spectacular heights.

title: The Loneliness of the Hockey Scout
description: What becomes of hockey players after their playing days? Commenting gigs on TV are in short supply, and coaching and general manager jobs in the N.H.L. are hard to come by, and harder to hold on to. Many become scouts, sitting in rinks, taking notes while watching teenagers who hope to make it as pros.

title: Bill Maher and Milo Yiannopoulos Find Common Ground
description: Despite a brief flare-up of controversy that preceded it, a conversation between Milo Yiannopoulos, the incendiary right-wing author and lecturer, and Bill Maher, the comedian and host of HBOs Real Time, on that program Friday night was a largely docile, chummy affair. There was little conflict or cross-examination, as both men chided the political left for avoiding or drowning out Mr. Yiannopouloss views rather than engaging with them.

description: mexico city climate

title: Photojournalisms Uncertain Future? She Begs to Differ.
description: The changes in technology and media upended traditional notions of photojournalism. But they have also provided new storytelling opportunities for groups who have been underrepresented.

title: Photojournalisms Uncertain Future? She Begs to Differ.
description: Earlier this week, Lens published a provocative and pessimistic interview about the state of photojournalism with Donald R. Winslow, the former editor of the NPPA magazine Press Photographer. Later that day, Leslye Davis, a young video journalist and photographer for The New York Times came into the Lens office with a differing, more optimistic point of view. Her conversation with James Estrin has been edited for clarity and brevity.

title: A Trump Ally in Congress Warns His State, California, to Make Nice
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Kevin McCarthy, the majority leader, keeps a souvenir from a dinner the night before this years inauguration behind his desk: an embossed menu autographed by Donald J. Trump. The president-elect was at his table. Mr. McCarthy is not only the second-most powerful Republican in the House  he is also one of the earliest and most earnest supporters of the new president.

title: The Murky Future of Nuclear Power in the United States
description: This was supposed to be Americas nuclear century.

description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: Tax Advice From Lawmakers Turned Lawbreakers
description: As if we all werent under enough stress, its tax time again. That means Ive got to account for how I spent a full year of my life, financially speaking.

title: Trumps Winter White House: A Peek at the Exclusive Members List at Mar-a-Lago
description: On any given weekend, you might catch President Trumps son-in-law and top Mideast dealmaker, Jared Kushner, by the beachside soft-serve ice cream machine, or his reclusive chief strategist, Stephen K. Bannon, on the dining patio. If you are lucky, the president himself could stop by your table for a quick chat. But you will have to pay $200,000 for the privilege  and the few available spots are going fast.

title: Republicans Charge Into Resistance at Tumultuous Town Halls
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, S.C.  The Republican lawmakers stood with fixed smiles, shifting in place, facing down turmoil but no trial inside a municipal courtroom overstuffed with constituents.

title: Once Again, the Estate Tax May Die
description: People who disapprove of the estate tax sometimes call it a death tax, but in 2010 it received a more colorful nickname: the Throw Momma From the Train tax.

title: Reluctant First Lady? Melania Trump Wouldnt Be the First to Claim That Title
description: Being first lady is technically a job without any official responsibilities, if you dont count the expectations of the president, his staff, American voters and a few thousand journalists.

title: The Culture of Nastiness
description: Perhaps the most memorable line from last years presidential debates was Donald J. Trumps characterization of Hillary Clinton after she alluded to his tax issues.

title: How to Make Your Money Last as Long as You Do
description: How long should you plan to live?

title: How Kevin Durant Became Silicon Valleys Hottest Start-up
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Until last summer, Kevin Durant was certainly famous, but maybe not famous enough.

title: Chalayan: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: Why You May Want to Be Your Own Boss
description: If President Trump and Congress follow through on the proposals they have offered for overhauling the tax code, some of the biggest effects could be felt by independent contractors.

title: Yes, Mr. President, Banks Are Lending
description: This is the party line: Banks arent lending nowadays because the regulatory burden they face is too onerous. And that is hurting the economy and job creation.

title: In Munich, Pence Says U.S. Commitment to NATO Is Unwavering
description: MUNICH  Bearing what he said was a message from President Trump, Vice President Mike Pence told anxious European political and security leaders on Saturday that the United States of America strongly supports NATO and will be unwavering in our commitment to this trans-Atlantic alliance.

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: A Letter From Zuckerberg and the Fall of PewDiePie
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Japanese Street Style: Woodblock Patterns, Colors and Pink Hair
description: Mark Hartman, 35, a photographer and director from Brooklyn, recently spent three weeks in Japan, chasing a lifelong fascination with the countrys culture. Along the way, he paused to document the idiosyncratic street styles he encountered in Tokyo, Kyoto, Naga and Naoshima, a small island in southern Japan known for its contemporary art museums. So much of Japanese culture is about what people dont say, Mr. Hartman said. So their fashion is sort of a statement in itself. It doesnt need to be explained.

title: Noise Complaint: A Loud, Low-Frequency Hum
description: Q. Recently, I noticed a loud, low-frequency hum inside my apartment in Astoria, Queens. (My brother and I own the four-unit building, and I live in one of the apartments.) I know my building is not the source because when I shut power off to the entire property, the noise continued. Some of the neighbors heard it, too. After walking around the neighborhood, I believe I found the source: A luxury rental building that just opened about 300 feet away. I feel like Im part of some Cold War torture experiment.  Where do I turn for help to do something about the noise?

title: With No Frills and No Commissions, Robinhood App Takes On Big Brokerages
description: A start-up called Robinhood Markets is taking on the big brokerage firms with its commission-free trading app, and appears to be making headway. Since its introduction in December 2014, the app has attracted a million users and executed more than $30 billion in trades, up from $2 billion in 2015.

title: Cheesecake for the Soul: A Golden Girls Cafe Opens
description: Picture it: Manhattan, 2017. A crisp Saturday morning. Every table in Rue La Rue Cafe  a new restaurant in Washington Heights dedicated to Rue McClanahan and her hit television series, The Golden Girls  was occupied, including one in a replica of the kitchen set from the show. The pumps Ms. McClanahan (Blanche) wore in the pilot episode are displayed in a glass case. Mannequins draped in her gowns surrounded a pianist and guitarist playing mellow jazz on a corner stage. Behind them, on a pedestal, was her 1987 Emmy for lead actress.

title: Trumps Rosy Scenario
description: The WSJ reports that the Trump administrations budget planning assumes very high economic growth over the next decade  between 3 and 3.5 percent annually. How was this number arrived at? Basically, they worked backwards, assuming the growth they needed to make their budget numbers add up. Credibility!

title: Yankees Dellin Betances Loses in Arbitration, and a War of Words Begins
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Winning an arbitration case was apparently not enough for Randy Levine, the Yankees president.

title: Greeks Turn to the Black Market as Another Bailout Showdown Looms
description: ATHENS  During seven years of a grinding economic crisis, Dimitri Tsamopoulos has lost at least half the clients from his once bustling tax consultancy. But in the past few months, business has jumped, not because the Greek economy is finally recovering but because it is falling even deeper into the abyss.

title: Molly Goddard: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: Trump, an Outsider Demanding Loyalty, Struggles to Fill Top Posts
description: MELBOURNE, Fla.  During President Trumps transition to power, his team reached out to Elliott Abrams for help building a new administration. Mr. Abrams, a seasoned Republican foreign policy official, sent lists of possible candidates for national security jobs.

title: Triple-Double, One and Done: A Taste of Russell Westbrooks Glory
description: All these years later, Ryan Gomes can remember the smallest details.

title: China Fights Spread of Deadly Avian Virus
description: BEIJING  The Chinese authorities are battling a surge in H7N9 bird flu infections, and have shuttered live poultry markets across the country after dozens of people in recent weeks were killed by the disease.

title: China Suspends All Coal Imports From North Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  China said on Saturday that it was suspending all imports of coal from North Korea as part of its effort to enact United Nations Security Council sanctions aimed at stopping the countrys nuclear weapons and ballistic-missile program.

title: A Worry on the Right That Trumps Conservative Acts Are Fleeting
description: WASHINGTON  When Donald J. Trump first tried a few years ago to line up a speaking slot at the marquee event for the conservative grass roots, the Conservative Political Action Conference, the organizers almost rejected him because they thought he was a fraud who only wanted a platform to promote his hotels, casinos, neckties and golf courses.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  If you were an elementary school-age child in New York City in the 1970s, as I was, you heard a lot about Esperanto. Esperanto, which means The Hoping One, is an auxiliary language that was a construction of Dr. Ludwig Zamenhof in the 19th century, and while it may be responsible for fostering good communication between countries with differing languages, it was used as a tool to keep students on their best behavior where I went to school.

title: Ports 1961: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: Iraqi Civilians Pay Heavy Price as Attack on ISIS in Mosul Nears
description: ERBIL, Iraq  Several hundred thousand civilians are enduring desperate conditions and facing retribution by Islamic State fighters in western Mosul as Iraqi forces prepare to attack militants who control the citys western half, according to residents and humanitarian groups.

title: Universities Face Pressure to Hold the Line on Title IX
description: Advocates are starting a campaign to try to persuade colleges to maintain the Obama administrations tough policies for protecting women on campuses from sexual assault, even if the Trump administration relaxes enforcement.

title: James Nichols, Linked to Oklahoma City Bombing, Dies at 62
description: James Nichols, a farmer who was detained as a possible accomplice but not charged as one after his brother Terry helped Timothy J. McVeigh detonate a truck bomb that killed 168 people in Oklahoma City in 1995, died on Tuesday in Saginaw, Mich. He was 62.

title: Trumps Dual Roles Collide With Openings in Dubai and Vancouver
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  The well-heeled guests strolled up red carpeted steps and through lines of smiling young women to reach the newest outpost in President Trumps international business empire.

title: J.W.Anderson: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: Seattle Mariners Add (and Add) to Their Core Strength
description: PEORIA, Ariz.  The Seattle Mariners have a new cap for spring training, in navy blue with a silver trident logo trimmed in teal. The trident forms the letter M, similar to symbols the franchise wore in its first 10 seasons, through 1986. The team dropped the logo then because a downward-facing trident was said to mean bad luck in Greek mythology.

title: South Korean Right Is Frozen, as Impeached Leaders Loyalists Wont Let Go
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Chung Kwang-yong choked up in describing how much he missed Park Geun-hye, the South Korean president, who has been cloistered in her official residence since her impeachment in December on corruption charges.

title: Norma McCorvey, Roe in Roe v. Wade, Is Dead at 69
description: Norma McCorvey, the anonymous plaintiff in Roe v. Wade, the landmark 1973 Supreme Court ruling that legalized abortion in the United States, reshaping the nations social and political landscapes and inflaming one of the most divisive controversies of the past half-century, died on Saturday in Katy, Tex. She was 69.

title: Canadas Darling, by the Way, Has a Brother in the N.H.L.
description: Stars defenseman Jamie Oleksiak is finally having his N.H.L. moment. A first-round pick in 2011, the 6-foot-7 Oleksiak has earned a regular spot in the Dallas lineup and is expected to establish new career highs in most statistical categories, even after missing a month because of a hand injury.

title: Theyre Safe in America. Now What?
description: The true story of a Syrian familys journey to America.

title: Where the Booze Can Kill, and Putin Is Deemed a Good Czar
description: IRKUTSK, Russia  The overworked cleaning woman realized that her grown son was not just sleeping off his habitual hangover in the Siberian city of Irkutsk when she discovered  to her horror  that he had quietly gone blind.

title: Omar Abdel Rahman, Blind Cleric Found Guilty of Plot to Wage War of Urban Terrorism, Dies at 78
description: Omar Abdel Rahman, the blind Islamic cleric whose fulminating sermons inspired violent fundamentalist movements in Egypt and, an American court found, a 1993 plot for a bombing rampage in New York, died on Saturday at a federal prison near Raleigh, N.C., where he was serving a life sentence. He was 78.

title: U.S. Wrestlers Find They Have Passionate Fans in Iran
description: IMAM KHOMEINI AIRPORT, Iran  When the United States wrestling team arrived at 3 a.m. on Saturday at an airport hotel outside Irans capital, Tehran, staff members ordered out for pizza.

title: Tom Reeds Town Hall Meeting in North Harmony, N.Y.
description: Representative Tom Reed, Republican of New York, led a contentious town hall-style meeting on Saturday morning in North Harmony, N.Y.

title: New Yalta
description: The first time I saw the famous photo of the 1945 Yalta Conference, I was shocked and enchanted. It seemed like a work of conceptual eclecticism, a collage, for those men were such different figures: Churchill, a servant of her majesty; Roosevelt, a democratically elected president; and Stalin, a bloody dictator.

title: Our Putin
description: WASHINGTON  On June 18, 2001, I attended Vladimir V. Putins first meeting with the American news media. We were seated at a large round table in the wood-paneled Kremlin Library. It was still early in Mr. Putins presidency, and we werent sure what to expect of this ex-K.G.B. spy fresh off the famous summit meeting where President George W. Bush had gotten a sense of his soul and pronounced him trustworthy. After we were kept waiting for what felt like hours, Mr. Putin finally arrived a little after 8 p.m., sat down and took questions until nearly midnight.

title: Breaking the Anti-Immigrant Fever
description: Americans have been watching the Trump administration unfold for almost a month now, in all its malevolent incompetence. From morning tweets to daytime news to late-night comedy, many watch and fret and mock, and then sleep, sometimes fitfully.

title: How Can We Get Rid of Trump?
description: Were just a month into the Trump presidency, and already so many are wondering: How can we end it?

title: Donald Trump Will Leave You Numb
description: Almost any five minutes of Donald Trumps mesmerizing, terrifying news conference on Thursday would have been enough to do another politician in.

title: Beltway Panic, Wall Street Zen
description: THE most grounded fears about a Donald Trump presidency have always involved incompetence rather than malevolence, the perils of a catastrophically weak presidency rather than the prospect of a near-dictatorship.

title: In Praise of Hypocrisy
description: Everybody lies. But American politics has long rested on a shared understanding of what it is acceptable to lie about, how and to whom.

title: First, Sex Ed. Then Death Ed.
description: FIVE years ago, I taught sex education to my daughter Tessas class. Last week, I taught death education to my daughter Sashas class. In both cases, I didnt really want to delegate the task. I wanted my daughters and the other children in the class to know about all of the tricky situations that might await them. I didnt want anyone mincing words or using euphemisms. Also, there was no one else to do it. And in the case of death ed, no curriculum to do it with.

title: Repeal the Health Law?
description: It seems reasonable to ask what Republicans have been doing for the last seven years.

title: The Social Scientific Case Against a Muslim Ban
description: There were many reasons to oppose President Trumps travel ban on refugees and visitors from seven predominantly Muslim countries, which is now blocked by a federal courts temporary restraining order. Unfortunately, those same objections are also likely to apply to the revised version of the executive order that Mr. Trump promised on Thursday, which will share with its predecessor the goal of immediately protecting the country  presumably by keeping out people from countries he deems to be a threat.

title: A Win for Free Speech and Gun Safety
description: Information saves lives. Thats not a complicated idea, especially when it comes to medical care. A doctors educated advice can make all the difference to a patient who may not fully appreciate health or safety risks.

title: The Risk of Unnamed Sources? Unconvinced Readers
description: THE news emanating from Washington these past two weeks has been relentless and the reporting on it impressive. There was the New York Times story on the nascent days of the White House, portraying top aides fumbling in the dark as they rethought their improv approach to governing. Then came coverage of a showdown that sent National Security Adviser Michael Flynn packing. That drama morphed into a scoopy Times article reporting that members of President Trumps campaign team had repeated contact with Russian intelligence officials before the election, for what reason we dont know.

title: When Its Time to Blow the Whistle
description: The spotlight has finally been put on the lowlife leakers! They will be caught! So tweeted President Trump on Thursday morning after a week when his administration had been shaken by reports based on information from anonymous sources inside the government and intelligence agencies. On Monday, such revelations had led to the resignation of Michael T. Flynn, the national security adviser.

title: Want Melania Trump in the White House? Pay Her
description: When does womens work become real work?

title: Trapped in Trumps Brain
description: WASHINGTON  Donald Trump is stuck in his own skull.

title: The Power of Movies to Change Our Hearts
description: When I was a child in Georgia, my mother would say, drink some water now, and use the bathroom before we go, so that when we got downtown, we would not have to drink from the water fountain for colored people, or use the segregated restroom.

title: Leave American Girls Alone
description: On Tuesday, the Mattel subsidiary American Girl unveiled the newest member of its iconic sorority: a blank-eyed boy named Logan.

title: The Secret Service of the Skies
description: When you think of security around the president of the United States, you most likely think of Secret Service officers in sunglasses, talking into microphones hidden in their cuffs. You probably dont think of the large bubble of restricted airspace that follows the president wherever he goes. These are essentially no-fly zones reaching up to 17,999 feet within a 30-nautical-mile radius of the president (a nautical mile is just over a regular mile). If you fly into that ring without permission from federal authorities, fighter jets will be on your wing before you can hum a few bars of Hail to the Chief.

title: Where in the World Can We Find Hope?
description: Liberal democracy in the West is on the fritz. The leader of the free world larded his recent news conference with false claims, while British legislators dither over their citizens reckless decision to leave the European Union. At the same time, nationalist, xenophobic movements across Europe are on the rise  promising, like Donald J. Trump, to stick it to those out-of-touch elites who dont understand the common people.

title: Are Liberals Helping Trump?
description: Jeffrey Medford, a small-business owner in South Carolina, voted reluctantly for Donald Trump. As a conservative, he felt the need to choose the Republican. But some things are making him feel uncomfortable  parts of Mr. Trumps travel ban, for example, and the recurring theme of his apparent affinity for Russia.

title: The Economy Is Free in Hong Kong. Running a Food Truck Isnt (See Annex C).
description: HONG KONG  For the 23rd year running, Hong Kong is, in the opinion of the conservative Heritage Foundation, the freest economy in the world. With low taxes, an efficient government and private businesses running the city buses and its spotless subways, this place is a libertarian dream come true.

title: Emilia Wickstead: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: In Bali, Babies Are Believed Too Holy to Touch the Earth
description: Babies on the Indonesian island of Bali dont start off life on the right foot  or on the left.

title: In 1968, a Resurrection City of Tents, Erected to Fight Poverty
description: The Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. often described poverty and prejudice as related enemies, and in the last few months of his life, he called publicly for a national demonstration by the poor that would confront the power structure massively.

title: Tap Your Toes Where Garth Brooks Played
description: Built in 1878, Gruene Hall is quintessentially Texan and also the oldest dance hall in the state. Willie Nelson, Loretta Lynn and Townes Van Zandt, have also performed there.

title: Simone Rocha: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: California, Parched for 5 Years, Is Now Battered by Water
description: A powerful storm with near hurricane-force winds swept through Southern California on Saturday, killing at least two people and causing widespread disruptions, but providing a definitive respite from five years of drought.

title: Craig Sager and Harvey Araton Are Honored by the Basketball Hall of Fame
description: NEW ORLEANS  Craig Sager, the former Turner Sports sideline reporter whose colorful interviews were a staple of N.B.A. broadcasts for decades, and Harvey Araton, a longtime staff writer and columnist for The New York Times, were honored on Saturday by the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame, which announced that they were the 2017 Curt Gowdy Media Award recipients for their contributions to basketball.

title: Geert Wilders, a Dutch Nationalist Politician, Calls Moroccan Immigrants Scum
description: Pledging to make the Netherlands ours again, the Dutch nationalist politician Geert Wilders, at a campaign event on Saturday, described Moroccan immigrants as scum who endanger the countrys citizens.

title: Gareth Pugh: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: New York Fashion Week in 60 Seconds
description: T Magazine's market director, Malina Joseph Gilchrist, recaps the fall/winter 2017 collections from New York.

title: Alison Hines, Nathan Koch
description: Alison Faith Hines and Nathan Vozza Koch were married Feb. 18 at the Garrison, an event space in Garrison, N.Y. Benjamin Malbin, a minister with American Marriage Ministries and a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Uh-Oh!
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  There are people who will say that puns are the lowest form of humor, and I generally dont bother arguing with them. I am someone who appreciates a good pun. I dont know what that says about me, but at a time when we could collectively use a sense of humor, I will take my guffaws where I can get them. That is yet another reason I turn to crossword puzzles, other than the fact that its my job to solve them and write about them.

title: Versus: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: More Cash and Less Flash for a Relaxed Yoenis Cespedes
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla  Stationed in Yoenis Cespedess parking spot at the Mets spring training site on Saturday was a white pickup truck with huge heavy-duty tires, enough to handle the needs of life on Cespedess ranch in nearby Vero Beach. The vehicle was hardly modest, but it was unassuming compared to what was parked in the same spot last year.

title: Trump to Interview 4 Candidates for National Security Adviser
description: MELBOURNE, Fla.  President Trump will interview four candidates on Sunday to replace his dismissed national security adviser, three of them military veterans, but one of Americas most prominent retired generals, whose name had been floated, is not in the running.

title: Trump More Streamlined Travel Ban Will Have a Rollout Plan
description: John F. Kelly, the secretary of Homeland Security, provided some details at the Munich Security Conference about a revised version of the Trump administrations executive order barring citizens of seven predominantly Muslim countries from entering the United States.

title: Fedor Emelianenkos Bout Against Matt Mitrione Is Canceled
description: A mixed martial arts fight between the heavyweights Fedor Emelianenko and Matt Mitrione, scheduled for Saturday night in San Jose, Calif., was canceled hours before the event because Mitrione became ill, Scott Coker, the president of Bellator MMA, announced via Twitter on Saturday afternoon.

title: Trump Returns to Campaign Trail After a Month in Office
description: MELBOURNE, Fla.  Never let it be said that President Trump waits until the last minute. With just 1,354 days until the next presidential election, Mr. Trump kicked off his re-election campaign here on Saturday with a boisterous, sign-waving, slogan-chanting, patriotic-song-singing rally that lacked only an opponent for him to run against.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Most presidents feel very strongly about the dignity of the office they hold. Mr. Trump has busted every norm in campaigning, and he seems to be doing the same with the traditions of his office.

title: Fact Check: What Trump Got Wrong at His Rally
description: Much seemed familiar on Saturday as President Trump held his first campaign rally as president  the hats, the chants, and even some of the misstatements and exaggerations made by Mr. Trump.

title: Carmelo Anthony, Reluctant All-Star, Earns Respite From Knicks Drama
description: NEW ORLEANS  Carmelo Anthony had planned to vacation with his family in Cuba and Puerto Rico. The costs of the trip were nonrefundable. Then the N.B.A. called.

title: Clyde Stubblefield, the Funky Drummer for James Brown, Dies at 73
description: It took only 20 seconds for Clyde Stubblefield to drum his way to immortality. They came near the end of James Browns Funky Drummer, recorded in a Cincinnati studio in late 1969. Brown counts him in  1, 2, 3, 4. Hit it!  and Mr. Stubblefield eases into a cool pattern, part bendy funk and part hard march. Its calm, slick and precise, and atop it, Brown asks over and over, Aint it funky?

title: Corrections: February 19, 2017
description: METROPOLITAN

title: Georgie Hambright, Bradley Tipper
description: Georgie Dru Hambright and Bradley Stockton Tipper were married Feb. 14 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Angel L. Lopez, a staff member in the office of the City Clerk, officiated.

title: Elizabeth Hobson, Richard Morris
description: Elizabeth Booth Hobson and Richard Adam Morris were married Feb. 18 at the Farm at South Mountain in Phoenix. Susan S. Ringler, a friend of the brides family who was ordained by both the Ecumenical Catholic Communion and the New Seminary, officiated.

title: Alexandra Gutman, Evan Levine
description: Alexandra Heather Gutman and Dr. Evan Daniel Levine were married Feb. 18 in New York. Cantor Hal Rifkin officiated at the Lighthouse at Chelsea Piers.

title: Brette Allen, Patrick Mowrer
description: Elizabeth Brette Allen and Stig Patrick Mowrer were married Feb. 17 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Alisa Fuentes, a staff member in the City Clerks office, officiated. On Feb. 25, Morgan P. Y. Monnet, a cousin of the groom, is to lead the couple in their vows at the Vizcaya Museum and Gardens in Miami.

title: Jaime Cosloy, Seth Schiffman
description: Jaime Dara Cosloy and Seth Fred Schiffman are to be married Feb. 19 at Seasons, an event space in the Township of Washington, N.J. Rabbi Lenny Mandel is to officiate.

title: Arielle Reich, Michael Mandell
description: Arielle Rachel Reich and Michael Craig Mandell are to be married on Feb. 19 at the Loading Dock, an event space in Stamford, Conn. Rabbi David Israel is to officiate.

title: Caitlin Sweany, Antonio Mndez
description: Caitlin Elizabeth Sweany, a daughter of Diana L. Johnson of Denver and the late Steven G. Sweany, is to be married Feb. 19 to Antonio Amable Mndez, the son of Juana Sosa-Mndez and Antonio A. Mndez of Yonkers. John Hickenlooper, the governor of Colorado, is to perform the ceremony at the Grant-Humphreys Mansion in Denver.

title: Where the Big Money Is
description: The number of billionaires is rising across the globe, and the sources of their wealth are changing in ways that reflect major shifts in global business trends.

title: Inside the Minds of the Ultrawealthy
description: I asked the psychologist Brad Klontz to tell me more about what its like to work with billionaires.

title: What Do Billionaires Have in Common? Big Bucks, and Not Much Else
description: What do Larry Ellison and Ingvar Kamprad have in common? They are both billionaires. But that may be one of the few characteristics they share.

title: Who Will Listen to a Billionaires Troubles?
description: Who doesnt want to be a billionaire? A millionaire, even? Think of all the troubles that would simply melt away.

title: The Rise and Decline of the Hedge Fund Billionaire
description: In the annals of the immensely wealthy, the hedge fund manager is a relatively new entry. It has been only about a decade since significant numbers of hedge fund managers, including Kenneth C. Griffin of Citadel, Paul Tudor Jones of Tudor Investment Corporation and Steven A. Cohen of Point72 Asset Management, began appearing on billionaire rankings.

title: Why You Might Not Want to Take Away a Billionaires Money
description: There is a problem with billionaires: Theyve got way more money than any human deserves.

title: Losing a Fortune Often Comes Down to One Thing: Family
description: SAN FRANCISCO  One of Frances Strohs earliest lessons about wealth involved a game she played as a 6-year-old with her father: how to not be kidnapped.

title: Where the Billionaires Come From
description: In the early 20th century, a young journalist named Napoleon Hill embarked on the assignment of a lifetime.

title: How Big Do You Want Your Nest Egg to Be?
description: Twenty million dollars. Thats how much Julien Mellon needs to live the life he wants. With that kind of cash, Mr. Mellon, a 32-year-old tour guide, could buy a beautiful home with enough left over to spend $100,000 a year (in 2017 dollars) until the day he dies.

title: Who Are the Richest of the Rich?
description: Sitting at a table, grinding his pinkie into the corner of his mouth and staring at the screen, Dr. Evil announces he is holding the world ransom for $1 million. Having been cryogenically frozen for 30 years, the comic villain created by the actor Mike Myers is shocked when he is told that $1 million isnt a lot of money in 1997.

title: Where the Worlds Wealthiest Invest Their Billions
description: Being part of the global billionaire class is beyond the imagination of most people. At the threshold of $1 billion, a 5 percent return would yield an annual interest payment of $50 million  without ever touching the principal. But how billionaires, from those in the single digits to near the top, invest shows a range of options for the very wealthiest in the world. One thing they all have in common is a large amount of money in cash or equivalently liquid securities. Heres a look at how 10 billionaires have made and invested their money, according to public filings gathered by the financial research firm Wealth-X.

title: How Mark Cuban Hangs Onto His Money
description: If there is a wild, out-there script to becoming a billionaire, Mark Cuban could lay claim to following it.

title: Donna Choi, Matthew Ellis
description: Donna Choi and Matthew Ryan Ellis are to be married Feb. 19 in Rockleigh, N.J. Caleb Clardy, a nondenominational minister, is to officiate at the Rockleigh, an event space.

title: Erin Lanahan, Andrew Williamson
description: Erin Marie Lanahan and Andrew Fisher Williamson are to be married Feb. 19 at the White Orchid Beach House in Makena, Hawaii. Abdi Nazemian, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, is to officiate.

title: Martha Norrick, Dominic Williams
description: Martha Ruth Norrick and Dominic Christian Williams are to be married Feb. 19 by Mayor Bill de Blasio at City Hall in Manhattan.

title: Alexandra Karasavva, Kyle Sinick
description: Alexandra Elena Karasavva and Kyle Benjamin Sinick were married Feb. 18 at the Harold Pratt House, an event space in Manhattan. Rabbi Joshua Stanton officiated.

title: Arts Groups Draft Battle Plans as Trump Funding Cuts Loom
description: A prominent Broadway producer pledged to make the case for the value of the arts directly to the Trump administration. The St. Louis Symphony drafted an email urging its board members to call their elected representatives. Midway through the Metropolitan Operas broadcast on Saturday afternoon, the companys general manager, Peter Gelb, warned listeners across the country that many of the radio stations they were tuned in to were facing serious cuts.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Big Little Lies and The Good Fight
description: Reese Witherspoon, Nicole Kidman and Shailene Woodley lead Big Little Lies, a brooding class drama set in California. And Christine Baranski is back as Diane Lockhart in The Good Fight, a spinoff of The Good Wife.

title: Iraq Starts Offensive to Retake Western Mosul From ISIS
description: ERBIL, Iraq  Iraq opened the next chapter in its offensive to drive the Islamic State out of Mosul on Sunday, preparing an assault on the western half of the city. Overnight, planes carpeted the ground with leaflets, directly appealing to the groups fighters to surrender.

title: The Convertible, Tiny Apartment
description: How do you transform a dated 400-square-foot studio into a modern home with room to hold a dinner party and welcome an occasional overnight guest?

title: Youre Always in Control of Your Belongings
description: Kseniya and Ryan Merritt live in a 400-square-foot apartment in Manhattan. Explore their bright, minimalist space with custom, convertible furnishings.

title: Margaret Howell: Fall 2017
description: Margaret Howell shows her fall collection.

title: Last Night in Sweden? Trumps Remark Baffles a Nation
description: LONDON  Swedes reacted with confusion, anger and ridicule on Sunday to a vague remark by President Trump that suggested that something terrible had occurred in their country.

title: Homes That Sold in New York City and Its Suburbs
description: 344 West 49th Street, No. 3E, Hells Kitchen

title: Anya Hindmarch
description: The label shows its fall collection.

title: Malaysia Seeks to Question 7 in Killing of Kim Jong-nam
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  The police in Malaysia are seeking seven more people in the assassination last Monday of the half brother of North Koreas leader, including four North Koreans who left Malaysia shortly after the killing, a top police official said Sunday.

title: Three Teaching Ideas for Making Presidents Day Great Again
description: As Joseph Berger observed in a 2009 Times article, Presidents Day is perhaps the only federal holiday thats free of parades and fireworks. Instead, for most of us, its just another day off  but with shopping.

title: Democratic Member to Quit Election Commission, Setting Up Political Fight
description: WASHINGTON  A Democrat on the Federal Election Commission is quitting her term early because of the gridlock that has gripped the panel, offering President Trump an unexpected chance to shape political spending rules.

title: Where to Spot the London Fashion Flock
description: Anyone who wants to catch a glimpse of the designers, editors, buyers and celebrities who turn the cogs of London Fashion Week will find an Art Deco-inspired restaurant called Casa Cruz is the best bet for a sighting.

title: Preen by Thornton Bregazzi: Fall 2017
description: The latest collection from the label.

title: First a Mistaken Burial as a Pauper. Then the Indignities Piled Up.
description: Karen Mary Connors lived alone and died that way in 2011. The only child of a New York City firefighter turned lawyer, she lived her final years cloistered in what had been her familys summer home in the Rockaways, with only a few houses standing between her and the Atlantic Ocean.

title: A Worried Europe Finds Scant Reassurance on Trumps Plans
description: MUNICH  They came from all over  diplomats and generals, policy experts and security officials  seeking clues to President Trumps ideas and intentions. They left without much reassurance.

title: SpaceX Launches Rocket Carrying Space Station Cargo
description: KENNEDY SPACE CENTER, Fla.  Engines ignited and a rocket lifted off here on Sunday, for the first time since the last space shuttle launch five and a half years ago.

title: London Fashion Weeks Latest Youthquake
description: It was Friday, the first day of London Fashion Week, and Donatella Versace was sitting in a hotel in Mayfair, finishing the preparations for her hard-driving, techno-fabulous Versus Versace show scheduled the next day.

title: For the Simone Rocha Show, Hair Was Sewn Into Place
description: Things are always a bit asymmetric and a little off at Simone Rocha, said the hairstylist James Pecis, smiling, backstage at the designers fall/winter 2017 show in London. The collection is all about layers and layering, so we have created two different textures to reflect that. He described the hair  a layered and textured take on a classic chignon as twisted military boy. And he used an actual upholstery needle to achieve the look.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Topshop Unique: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: SpaceX Launches Rocket to International Space Station
description: A Falcon 9 rocket from Elon Musks Space Exploration Technologies Corporation, or SpaceX, was launched at the John F. Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Sunday, carrying supplies, experiments and cargo to the International Space Station.

title: Will Brazilians Cancel Carnival?
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  As many as 70 towns and cities around Brazil are reported to have canceled Carnival festivities this year because they are suffering from the worst recession in the countrys recent history.

title: Heng on Trumps Approach to North Korea
description: President Trump has advocated an aggressive stance towards both China and North Korea but he may now turn to Beijing for help as North Korea recently tested an intermediate-range missile.

title: Peter Pilotto: Fall 2017
description: The labels fall 2017 rtw collection.

title: With Coverage in Peril and Obama Gone, Health Laws Critics Go Quiet
description: WASHINGTON  For seven years, few issues have animated conservative voters as much as the repeal of the Affordable Care Act. But with President Barack Obama out of office, the debate over Obamacare is becoming less about Obama and more about care  greatly complicating the issue for Republican lawmakers.

title: Suicide Bombing in Somalia Kills Dozens at a Market
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  A large explosion ripped through a busy market here on Sunday, killing at least 30 people and exposing the grave security challenges that Somalias new president faces.

title: Russia Stirs Friction in Balkans, as NATO Keeps an Uneasy Peace
description: ZVECAN, Kosovo  In the densely forested mountains along the contested frontier between Serbia and Kosovo, a patrol of American soldiers under NATO command trudged through snow and mud, keeping an eye out for smugglers or anyone else trying to cross the border. Given the bloody legacy of this area, the situation is quiet now, at least up here.

title: A Long-Running Scandal and a Senate Pick Stir Corruption Questions in Alabama
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  When Luther Strange ran for attorney general in this scandal-weary state in 2010, he appeared in an advertisement that spoke darkly of the Alabama capitals corruption, grand jury investigations, insider deals, abusing the public trust.

title: Newer Tech, Fewer Jobs
description: In the drilling industry, technological innovations are making it possible to do more with fewer people on the payroll.

title: Texas Oil Fields Rebound From Price Lull, but Jobs Are Left Behind
description: MIDLAND, Tex.  In the land where oil jobs were once a guaranteed road to security for blue-collar workers, Eustasio Velazquezs career has been upended by technology.

title: A Back-Channel Plan for Ukraine and Russia, Courtesy of Trump Associates
description: A week before Michael T. Flynn resigned as national security adviser, a sealed proposal was hand-delivered to his office, outlining a way for President Trump to lift sanctions against Russia.

title: In the Land of Opera, a Choir for the Tone Deaf

title: Kraft Heinz Withdraws $143 Billion Offer to Merge With Unilever
description: On Friday, Kraft Heinz seemed determined to press ahead with a $143 billion takeover bid for Unilever, an ambitious campaign that would have put dozens of the best-known names in consumer households around the world under one roof.

title: Michael Novak, Catholic Scholar Who Championed Capitalism, Dies at 83
description: Michael Novak, a Roman Catholic social philosopher who abandoned the liberal politics he espoused in the 1960s to make the theological and moral case for capitalism in a series of widely discussed books, died on Friday at his home in Washington. He was 83.

title: A Yiddish-Cuban Opera to Have Its Premiere in Havana in March
description: Yiddish-Cuban opera is not something you come across every day. But a new one composed by Frank London of the Klezmatics  based on an 86-year-old Yiddish poem about Hatuey, the Taino chief who resisted the Spanish invaders  will have its premiere at Teatro Arenal in Havana on March 3.

title: The Great Wall Topples at North American Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  In an embarrassment for Dalian Wanda Group, the Chinese conglomerate determined to become a global film superpower, its first mega-budget production, The Great Wall, fizzled in North American release over the weekend.

title: Teenager With Pellet Gun Is Killed by Police After Robbery in Brooklyn

title: Jordan Spieth, His Feet Firmly Grounded, Puts a Sensible Shoe Forward
description: MALIBU, Calif.  The golf shoes on display in a back room at Nobu Malibu, a restaurant overlooking the Pacific Ocean, would have looked at home in the nearby Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles. They were artwork for the sole, pairs of shoes adorned with leis, plaid, a California grizzly bear and numbers  notable scores and finishes that marked steps in the ascent of Jordan Spieths career.

description: LONDON  For a relatively small country, Britain is blessed with a multitude of regional and even neighborhood accents.

title: Federal Agency Begins Inquiry Into Auto Lenders Use of GPS Tracking

title: Trump Proposal Would Deport More Immigrants Immediately
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  Federal authorities would be empowered to immediately deport vastly more undocumented immigrants as part of a broad crackdown being developed by the Trump administration that would significantly change the way federal agencies enforce immigration laws.

title: PewDiePie Dust-Up Shows Risks Brands Take to Tap Into Social Media
description: Social media has produced its own breed of stars, from the video bloggers of YouTube to the style mavens of Instagram, and major media companies and brands have increasingly turned to this group as a way to reach the ad blockers and cord cutters of the world.

title: With Jonathan Quick Returning, Kings Are Ready for Playoff Push
description: EL SEGUNDO, Calif.  There were plenty of reasons for optimism when the Los Angeles Kings returned from their bye week last Wednesday in contention for a Western Conference playoff spot. But the most encouraging sign may have been the recent return to practice of their star goaltender, Jonathan Quick, whose 2016-17 season has been limited to a single period of play.

title: Review: The Breaks Captures Hip-Hop in the 90s, Music and All
description: Its easy to think of hip-hop as a collection of superstars and strivers, full of faces angling to be seen. But in truth, hip-hop is an ecosystem favoring the industrious  talent scouts, managers, club promoters, photographers, journalists and more. Without all the activity buzzing behind the scenes, the scene itself would be dull.

title: Has the Art Market Become an Unwitting Partner in Crime?
description: When you sell your home the paperwork details the sale, including your name, and the title search lists the names of the people who owned the property before you. But when someone sells an artwork at auction  even something worth $100 million, much more than your house  the identity is typically concealed.

title: A Different Kind of Dystopian Novel
description: On the morning after the election disbelief prevailed, especially among the pollsters.

title: Liberals Are Still Angry, but Merrick Garland Has Reached Acceptance

title: Might Ivanka Trump Speak Up if Her Father Guts the Arts?
description: Ivanka Trump recently helped defend gay rights from a proposed executive order from her father, Donald J. Trump, that would have scrapped Obama-era L.G.B.T. protections. Now, with the White House drafting plans to eliminate the National Endowments for the Arts and the Humanities, it is Ms. Trump who could emerge as a key player again, inasmuch as culture has been a rich part of her life.

title: Small Plane Crashes in New Jersey

No one on the ground was injured. No information about the pilots condition was immediately available. The F.A.A. said it would investigate the crash, which led to power failures and numerous street closures in the area.

title: Mets Start the Spring as Big Spenders, and Still Carrying a Surplus

The Mets gave a clear signal that they were serious about contending for the World Series when they re-signed outfielder Yoenis Cespedes to a four-year deal worth $110 million, the largest contract in the major leagues this off-season. The re-signings of relievers Jerry Blevins and Fernando Salas, for deals that could be worth up to $17 million combined, reinforced the notion.

title: The Good Fight Recap: On the Other Side
description: On the surface, The Good Fight has much in common with its predecessor, The Good Wife. The power plays among Chicagos elite lawyers lend the series a bracing wit. Role reversals happen with breakneck speed. Clothing informs characterization as much as dialogue does. There are, of course, familiar faces and names. Occasionally Alicia Florrick, the prickly lead of the original series, is mentioned in passing. But The Good Fight stands on its own because of the way it traffics in the thorny dynamics that arise among women who are navigating professional minefields, complex desires and identity politics. The way these women relate to each other as colleagues, lovers and friends powers the entire show.

title: John McCain Becomes Critic in Chief of the Trump Administration
description: WASHINGTON  Senator John McCain has long had a reputation as a political maverick. But with the rise of a president who has vowed to shatter the old order, Mr. McCain has emerged as an outspoken defender of longstanding Republican verities on foreign policy and as one of his partys most biting critics of the new commander in chief.

title: When Retirement Comes With a Daily Dose of Cannabis
description: Ruth Brunn finally said yes to marijuana. She is 98.

title: At World Trade Center Memorial, a Bombing Is Forgotten
description: They came to Lower Manhattan from around the world to visit the 9/11 Memorial on an unseasonably warm winter day. They came to see where it had happened  where terrorists had crashed two jetliners into the World Trade Center towers, destroying them in horrific plumes of ash, flames and pulverized concrete.

title: Ivor Nol Hume, Archaeologist of Colonial America, Dies at 89
description: Ivor Nol Hume, an accidental, self-taught English-born archaeologist who unearthed the earliest extensive traces of British colonial America, a town that had vanished after a massacre almost 350 years earlier, died on Feb. 4 at his home in Williamsburg, Va. He was 89.

title: Rough First Week Gives Betsy DeVos a Glimpse of the Fight Ahead

She encountered an immediate display of the type of fierce resistance she will face as she tries to set new policies for the Education Department.

title: Why Donald Trump Doesnt Understand Black Life
description: If you want to claim, as President Trump has, that you are the least racist person, its a good idea to avoid suggesting that one member of a racial group knows another person of that same group, simply because they share the same racial identity. It suggests you view them as people without individual distinction, personality and experiences, as interchangeable pieces of an unknowable other.

title: Jim Mattis to Baghdad: Were Not in Iraq to Seize Anybodys Oil

There is, as far as we can tell, no serious analysis behind this optimism; instead, the number was plugged in to make the fiscal outlook appear better.

title: Bringing Back Clumpy Mascara and Overly Straightened Hair
description: Its about a beautiful urban explorer, said the makeup artist Lynsey Alexander backstage at Topshop Uniques fall/winter 2017 show. Shes a girl who likes to have fun. Taking Danny Boyles cinematic ode to hedonism  the 2000 film The Beach  as the transportive starting point, Alexander created a deconstructed makeup that featured heavily clumpy mascara. Layers and layers of Topshops False Lash Intense Mascara were applied from the bottom before squishing the lashes together with tweezers. Alexander then added a beachy pout using the burnished hue Lip Kit in Crazy Beautiful (which hits stores in March). Its a paint that were layering up in the center of the lips and then blurring out at the edges, she explained before pulling out her secret weapon  a mattifier to give the lips a stamped-on tone that felt more natural and undone.

title: Syria Bombing Kills 4 Russians
description: MOSCOW  Four Russian servicemen were killed and two were wounded in Syria last week when their car was blown up by a remote-controlled bomb, the Russian news agency Interfax reported on Monday, citing a statement by the Defense Ministry in Moscow.

title: Changing the Windows 10 Default Browser
description: Q. I have a PC with Windows 10 Professional. When I click the e on the bottom left of the screen, I get Edge. I went to Settings and chose Internet Explorer as the default. However, I still get Edge when I click the e. How do I place the Internet Explorer symbol at the bottom left of the screen, so that I get Internet Explorer when I click that symbol?

title: Moonlight and Arrival Win Top Honors at Writers Guild Awards
description: Moonlight and Arrival walked away with the top screenplay honors on Sunday night at the Writers Guild Awards, the last of the major industry prizes to be doled out before the Oscars this coming Sunday. Moonlight won for best screenplay, and Arrival for best adapted screenplay; it was based on the Ted Chiang novella Story of Your Life.

title: From Couture to Cuisine: Ralph Lauren Opens a London Restaurant
description: LONDON  Fashion people are not necessarily known for their love of food, but Ralph Lauren is on a quest to change all that.

title: WhatsApps New Feature Continues Facebooks Snapchat Mimicry
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Facebook offered $3 billion to buy the ephemeral messaging app Snapchat in 2013. Snapchats founder, Evan Spiegel, turned down the offer.

title: Huishan Zhang: Fall 2017
description: The label shows its fall collection.

title: Deep in Brazils Amazon, Exploring the Ruins of Fords Fantasyland
description: FORDLNDIA, Brazil  The Amazon jungle already swallowed the Winding Brook Golf Course. Floods ravaged the cemetery, leaving behind a stockpile of concrete crosses. The 100-bed hospital designed by the acclaimed Detroit architect Albert Kahn? Plunderers destroyed it.

title: Bolshoi Theater General Directors Term Extended
description: Vladimir Urin, the general director of the Bolshoi Theater since 2013, will remain in his position for an unspecified further term, according to the Russian news agency RIA Novosti. The announcement came after a meeting between Mr. Urin and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, which was reported on Mr. Putins website on Friday.

title: From an Anchors Lips to Trumps Ears to Swedens Disbelief
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  On Friday night, Fox News aired an alarming six-minute segment in which the host, Tucker Carlson, interviewed a documentary filmmaker about a crisis of violence in Sweden ignited by the recent wave of Muslim migration.

description: Its raining in California.

description: The label shows its fall collection.

title: Jon Niese, Ex-Met, Starts Over With the Yankees
description: TAMPA, Fla.  After a dismal season, knee surgery and then his release from the Mets, Jon Niese waited and waited and waited for a team to offer him a major league contract.

title: Netanyahus Planned Visit to Australia Is Met With Opposition
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The first visit to Australia by an Israeli prime minister was intended to be a warm meeting between the leaders of two countries with strong trade ties, giving Benjamin Netanyahu some positive coverage as his nation faces broad condemnation for pushing to expand settlements on the West Bank.

title: Turkey Tries 47 Ex-Soldiers in Erdogan Assassination Plot
description: IZMIR, Turkey  Dozens of former Turkish soldiers were brought to trial on Monday on charges of trying to kill President Recep Tayyip Erdogan during a coup attempt in July, the latest in a series of trials in the plot.

title: Looking Back on Haydns Legacy at the Chamber Music Society
description: The Classical Style  the musical principles conceived by Haydn in the 18th century  will be the theme of the 2017-18 season at the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center.
